text: I personally think bikini Wednesday is an awesome idea & all of the girls look bomb. Just don't bring your boyfriend around if you can't handle girls in bikinis.   The delish sandwiches don't hurt either :)

One of the best sandwich shops in town. ..The pig kahuna is incredible! Everyone there is really nice and the set up is cool. Not the cheapest sandwich shop in town but definitely worth the money. Ive been twice now and will go back a lot more!

Just happened to see the Beach Hut sign as I left BJ'S one night. I got really excited. This place is originally from my home town in Northern California. Some of the best and biggest sandwiches you'll ever have. I recommend the old favorite "Surfin' Bird" or if you're feeling like something really different try the "Woody" or the "Pig Kahuna". Everything here is amazing. You can't go wrong. Also, if you like good beer, try "Eye of the Hawk". This is one of the coolest locations I've ever been to. Lots of seating, including a large outdoor area that is great for lounging. They also have a few TV's, darts and beer pong available.

Great place for an awesome time and great food. Some of the best sandwiches in town. Steve and Courtney are great hosts.  Beach hut is a nice place to relax and hang with friends.  We go for trivia night every Thursday.  They have a great selection of craft beers on tap.  And the surfin bird is by far the best thing on the menu.
This place has the most amazing food ever!! Awesome beer selection, bottomless mimosas, TV'S everywhere and an entire outdoor seating area with games!! You can't go wrong here!! Love this place!!

Ate at this spot this afternoon after seeing mostly favorable reviews on Yelp. For a quick summary: I could not have possibly been more disappointed. 

The menu looked fantastic, but a bit overwhelming.  The decor was cool and everything smelled great. I went with a pastrami and turkey on a French roll with pepper jack, chips and a fountain drink. 

The Co2 was out in the soda machine, so I went to the cashier to let her know, and to request a bottled soda instead. After waiting 5 minutes for someone to talk to, I gave up and just took the soda. 

I then waited outside for 20 minutes (literally) before going in to ask about my sandwich.  One of the employees apologized for the delay, which was cool, I get it things happen. He offered me a bag of chips to compensate for the delay, which was also cool but I'd already purchased (and finished) a bag. 

After 5 more minutes my sandwich came, and wow. The pastrami was so bland I'd swear it was roast beef. The turkey was decent, but it's almost impossible to mess that up. I asked for mayo and mustard, and received about a liter of each, globbed into the connected part of the roll. I had to rip about 1/3 of the bun off to use as a condiment squeegee in order to make the sandwich edible. Forced down the remainder and left as disappointed as my parents every time I brought home a report card. 

Cost for my terrible sandwich, soda and a bag of chips? $15 bucks, which was about $17 bucks too much. 

I'd love to say I will give this place another shot since it's so close to my home, but after the trifecta of bad service, bad food, and overpriced, I highly doubt it.
This place is literally the best place ever... The sandwiches are unbelievable and the service is nuts, the owners are so awesome and Melanie and Andrea super cool...

Not too impressed with the rude staff.. Expected a little more in customer service. Wasn't entirely impressed with the food either... Won't be back with all of the other choices in the plaza. Was excited to try awhile ago but disappointed and won't be back in the future.

This place is really good. We tried it for the first time today in hopes of a good lunch spot. Sandwiches were great and big! We did not leave hungry at all. The options would fit anyone's taste. 

Cool vibe inside, and would definitely be fun for a brunch or happy hour! The patio was cool especially for fall or spring when it's not so hot. 

Only gave 4 stars because it was a little pricey for sandwiches but overall I would highly recommend. And we will be going back!

This place is simply THE BEST Sandwhich place. 

I love me some Panera, Capriotti's, Port of Subs, Firehouse, and even Subway. This is the Rolls Royce of Sandwhich shops! Great portions, amazing and fresh toppings.  The service is great, they are all so pretty ;) 

I had tha Santa Cruz which is pastrami, avocado, bacon and cream cheese, and I'm pretty sure angel dust. It was heavenly! I can't wait to go back. 

My co-worker had the Haole Cheese Steak which is hot roast beef, Monterey jack, cream cheese, onions and peppers with a special spicy marinade, and nearly had to change his pants from excitement...

This place. I'm a fan. I was able to eat my huge sandwhich for Lunch, and Dinner. 
Please support this amazing establishment, I know I plan to.

My boyfriend and I both had salads here a few days ago, and we both thought that they were just okay. He had the super salad, which wasn't really that super since it was lacking in toppings. The only protein on this salad is edamame and there were only 5 of them. The rest of the toppings seemed sparse compared to the amount of lettuce that was included. I got the Cabo salad, which had a good amount of toppings and chicken. It was a typical taco style salad. The tortilla chips on it seemed a little old and stale. We could have gotten tastier, better quality salads at Panera for a little less money. We thought that the salads were a little over priced for what you actually get. The restaurant itself has a really nice beach feel with cool decor and surf music. All of the employees were very friendly but we waited quite a while for two salads.

Everything about this place rocks my world! The atmosphere is casual and friendly! It has indoor and outdoor seating, TV's for the sports fans, and the food is delicious!  I don't think I can make sandwiches at home anymore (and I make a pretty good sammich!) It is so much better to get one from Beach Hut! They have so many choices-not only of sandwiches, but meats, breads, condiments and toppings. It is fresh and fast and served on a Frisbee-so it pretty much screams awesome!! They have beer on tap, ya can't beat beer, sandwiches and sports! But they do-their staff is friendly, fun and constantly making sure we have everything we need and want. Courtney and Steve are so nice, and really want to give the best service and food possible! I'm already eating there once a week, I think I'm going to have to make it at least twice a week!

This is hands down the best deli around!  I always get the Surfin Bird because it is SO delicious!  No other deli can match the variety and the deliciousness and the amount of toppings!  I recently tried the loaded potato soup as well and it was delicious!  The place is decorated in a beach theme and theres a variety of shows playing on the tvs all around the room.  The staff is always helpful and they make the sandwiches quickly.

I eat here pretty regularly. They have huge sandwiches, I can barely finish a small. The service is great, and it's pretty healthy food. I like that they post the calories of each sandwich on the menu. I'm a big fan of the surfin' bird. The outdoor seating is nice, but sometimes gets invaded with smokers. Great price for the quality and amount of food you get.

I was really impressed for about two when I started coming here on my lunch breaks from school. But then after a few days spending at least $10 each visit for a medium sandwich then $5 for chips and a drink. It sucks. I can't leave there without spending $18 on lunch and the staff isn't too pleasing. On a students tiny budget I don't think I'll be eating here anymore.
Delicious!!! Had the Surfin Bird in a lettuce wrap and really enjoyed it!
I absolutely love the Santa Cruz and the sun burn sandwiches. Friendly staff very energetic and welcoming. It's almost like a family laid back island atmosphere.

Went there at about 750 tonight. I wish I could have tried this place because the smell was amazing! However, I stood at the front for about 7-8 minutes (no exaggeration, I was reading everything on the menu) and no one greeted me. I mean no welcome, no one even there to take my order. There were people in what I assumed was the back dining room playing around and a guy with his back to me on a laptop at a far counter. Otherwise it was a ghost town. Super bummed about the lack of service! I ended up leaving and hitting up another one of the dozen restaurants in the complex because afterall, I needed to eat.  I'll probably be back but I won't wait as long as I did, fool me once shame on you etc. There are tons of great sandwich shops in my area so if I get bad service again, I'll just continuing eating elsewhere.

I can't figure out why this place has an empty seat on Sunday afternoon. Indoor and outdoor seating with the most laid back atmosphere in Vegas. And here's the biggest problem: the sandwiches are so good you can't take a small bite. So you don't. You just shove your face right in there grin as sammich fillings drip off your face. Extra napkins are on the table.

Just had the santa cruz sandwich with pasatrami and bacon.  Pastrami was really good, but the bun was very soggy   and there was no cream cheese on it.  Very expensive 9 dollars for a small sub.  Very disapointed .  Will not be going back.

Made one of the greatest decisions I've made this week by trusting the great reviews of this awesome establishment!!! From the super laid back music, decor, and attentive staff. The food speaks volumes and not just in taste, the portions will knock your socks off (which is a good thing since you're technically at the "BEACH!") 

My husband and I shared the large "Santa Cruz" (hot pastrami, melted provolone, cream cheese, mayo, must, lettuce, onions, pickles, peppers, bacon, and avocado!!!) words can't explain the multitudes of flavor profiled in this beautifully built sandwich! The large was enough for us both along with a bag of "dirty" chips and a tall 32oz longboard lager to wash it down!!! Needless to say I'm one happy girl!!! 

If you are looking for amazing food, beer, music, and a great staff then this is definitely your place!!!

I absolutely love this place. 

The first time I tried Beach Hut I was on vacay in Reno. I had major sammich withdraws until they opened up this location. 

Beach hut really knows how to make a proper sammich, like the kind that barely fits in your mouth. I can't seem to get away from my plain and boring turkey and provolone even though I really want to try the Beach Meat Ball, and the Spicolli. My boyfriend is ridiculously picky about his sammiches, and this place nails it for him every time! 

Along with a great sammich, they have a decent selection of chips (not that crap you find at Port of Subs), and other munchies... try the chili nachos!  Plus you can wash it all down with an ice cold beer... great selection of micro beers. 

They have a nice size covered patio if you chose to eat outside, which isn't really common here in Vegas, but if you prefer to sit inside the booths are comfy, and there's even a comfy couch, so you can feel like you're having a sammich at home! 

I've yet to be here for any of the live music events, but I bet it would be a great time!

Today was my first time coming here. I was really excited to try it out but I left incredibly disappointed. I waited almost 45 minutes for a sandwich. A SANDWICH. It wasn't worth it. The vibe inside is really chill and everyone is friendly but It's honestly RIDICULOUS to wait 45 minutes for a SANDWICH. Unless you have plenty of time to waste, I wouldn't recommend coming here.

My first time here and I like the place. Great sandwiches and salads made to order, they have beer and indoor outdoor seating.  Very comfortable and chill. My daughter and I had A GREAT  lunch. I will definitely be back.

So, I know that this place may not be for everyone, but for what it is I think it's the best that I've found in LV so far.  If you want a fully dressed sandwich that can be cold or hot with quality ingredients, this is the place for you!  They also serve beer, soups, and a variety of other things if you're not in the mood for a sandwich. There is indoor and outdoor seating, the employees are friendly, the prices match the size of their sandwiches, and the place is pretty slow...I know that this may not be a perk to them or everyone else, but when you want to go with a small group of friends and not be overrun by other customers it really comes in handy.  I really hope they're able to stay open, but I also really hope that it doesn't get too busy and we can continue to enjoy this small slice of sandwich heaven! :)
Delicious and the only place i know where you get cream cheese in your sandwich. Mouthwatering goodness! So glad we discovered a new place to get great sandwiches.

Extremely unprofessional. My husband and kids ate here a few weeks ago and I watched as employees drank beer and took shots on the job. There was a female there that explained she was new and i felt so bad for her as the manager of the store and cooperate manager yelled at her for overcharging me. I didn't mind, i wanted a bigger sandwich anyways...but the way they treated that poor girl melted my heart. This restaurant should not be in business, I have worked at multiple restaurants around the valley and have never seen such an unprofessional place in my life!!! The girls shorts were so short they might as well just been in there underwear. As well as the shoes they were wearing, flip flops, boots, etc. I don't think cooperate is aware of how unprofessional this place is but they NEED TO MAKE CHANGES. I overheard employees discussing drug use, (marijuana and pills) and was floored. I then did research on this company and I  finally realized why its so unprofessional because they only have one location in Vegas which they obviously have forgotten about. Point being if you want to be in a place where the employees are unprofessional and drunk this is the perfect place for you. VERY UNPROFESSIONAL, DIRTY, AND THEY OBVIOUSLY DO NOT KNOW WHAT THE HEALTH DEPARTMENT REQUIRES TO WORK! TERRIBLE PLACE
Yum! Super salad is fantastic! Sandwiches are really good too. Good service. Definitely going back.

Deli Sandwiches and great beer. I should love this place, but I struck out. Again and again, first it closes way too early. So, it took a few attempts to try them when open. Then, finally, the stars aligned. The number of sandwich choices is a bit overwhelming. Most reviews raved over the cream cheese on the sandwiches since I don't dig cream cheese I was left uncertain on what to order. 

We asked for recommendations and settled on the turkey, avocado, bacon and provolone ($7.50 sm) and the pulled pork splashed with Tabasco BBQ sauce, cheddar and pineapple ($10.50). They have Kona on tap which is a huge win! We ordered two beers ($7.90 each). Rather than the cashier informing us it was happy hour, I happened to catch the sign in just the nick of time. He corrected the order, and we got 2-for-1 beers. Yeah! 

While we waited for our sandwich we admired the atmosphere and enjoyed our beers. We love the laid back beach atmosphere. Our sandwiches were brought over on Frisbees - love it. We dug into our sandwiches - didn't love it. 

The bread was thick, dense and while sturdy it wasn't too tasty. They lay it on thick so these are sandwiches for hearty appetites. However, the blend of fillings didn't thrill us. The turkey tasted purely like mustard, the avocado would shoot out the side every time I took a bite. It was difficult to eat about 1/2 way thru I gave up. The pork was ok, but it was ruined by the tabasco BBQ sauce. There was so much of it there was no way to escape it. It completely overpowered any taste of cheddar or pineapple. 

Perhaps we chose poorly, but these sandwiches came highly recommended. I'm not sure that I'd return to try others. It's a real shame because the beer options are fantastic. It'd be better if this was primarily a bar.

2.5 stars

Solid sandwiches, good quality meats and interesting creations. The place is very nicely decorated, and there is an outside patio that on a nice day could be very enjoyable. 

Though service is a bit slow for a sandwich shop, it is totally worth the wait. Their serving are massive, I ordered a medium sandwich and could only eat half ( and trust me, I can eat).
What set my sandwich apart, was the Italian dressing, it brought all the flavored together and made it a very tasty meal. Even a better one a couple hours later when I ate the other half at work. 

Natasha (wife), got a turkey sandwich, it had bacon and avocado in it, the bacon was too crispy, and the cream cheese was just chunked in there, maybe great for some people but she didn't care for both the bacon or cream cheese. Once she removed those ingredients, she enjoyed her meal.

Totally worth another visit and try a couple more of their sandwich creations.

This is the best place to get food and beer in Las Vegas. Period. The team there is awesome and the atmosphere is like nothing else in Las Vegas. I am a beer and food fan. I am not a gambling fan. This rules out 99.9% of bars in Las Vegas. Beach Hut is the only .1% that I have found. 

They have about 6 revolving taps but always have Eye of the Hawk on tap (which if you haven't had, please turn off your computer and go to Beach Hut and order a pint). If you like craft beer, this is the place for you. (btw all beers are happy hour cheap... seriously)

Now, the food. Well what can I say? The sandwiches are huge, delicious, customizable, and bacon is always at the ready. They have some really amazing combinations that are just amazing.

There is outdoor seating (which is nice if you regularly dine in the local caves), indoor seating, big TVs with sports or the Food Network on, reggae playing, super chill atmosphere. They have bands play there every now and again at night. 

TL;DL: Bomb Food, Bomb beer, Bomb people, just go and have a sammy and a pint- thank me later.

This was good--I need killer bread on a sub to call a place "great", but when it comes to being generous with the toppings, Beach Hut Deli is in front of the pack.  As you walk in, there is a large menu posted on the left hand side of the room. Decide there and move to the register to order. I was dining with a group of low-carbers so each of them ordered their meals with no bread. Apparently at BHD that is code for "make me a lettuce wrap". 

My sandwich was LARGE. Check the photos from this place. They are not skimpy on the ingredients by any means. I had extra vegetables on my wheat sub and had to pull it apart to start to eat. There was nothing outstanding about the bread or the turkey. In fact, the bread fell apart quite a bit as I was eating. It made for a messy, but satisfying meal. I don't think I have had a sandwich with so much vegetable topping on it anywhere else. 

They did not season the sandwich (that I could tell) much and the side of Italian dressing was necessary for me to enjoy the meal. 

I think the best thing about BHD is how much care they put in their wraps. The low-carbers were VERY satisfied with their meals. One low-carber even had a hot dog wrapped in a bunch of veg and lettuce. I didn't have the heart to post that very odd looking photo. Sorry Mike T. Often when I order wraps the food is messily falling out of the wrap. No so at BHD; they know how to deal with the no-bread issue. 

All in all, the food was solid and plentiful. I appreciate the value and I will be back.

Awesome sandwiches. Steve, the manager, is such a great guy. Excellent service. And live music on fridays! Super fun for the family to go to. And they have really good craft brew on tap. I recommend the santa cruz or the surfin bird. But seriously, every sandwich we've tried so far is so full of meat and toppings, they're all amazing. Not to mention the genius addition of cream cheese to various sandwiches. Check it out if you're in the area!

I accidentally came across this place doing job applications with my friend. We originally went in because we needed water but the menu board was so enticing. The sandwiches have a unique variety and some great ingredients like avocado and bacon... my favorites. They use cream cheese on the sandwiches... who knew it worked so well! Absolutely delicious. Sadly, I live on the east side and it's so far from me. But any change I get to be I on that side of town I definitely eat there. The staff was nice and they have a great little shaded out door seating area. It wasn't too busy when I went, I imagine it can get busy though with those sandwiches! Ugh, cant get enough. I love finding places like this.

First of all the girl working at the counter had no clue what she was doing, nor did she care. I was immediately turned off but was hungry & in a hurry. After navigating her cash register with the ease of a drunk toddler my bill came to $12. Twelve dollars. What did I get for my hard earned $12? A 6" hot sandwich & small soda. Wow. This better be the best sandwich ever. 

Well, they couldn't even provide that. I ordered one of the only things on the menu that didn't say spicy (and shouldn't be spicy). Get back to work, first angry bite in my mouth lights up like the Fourth of July. Spicy as hell. So now I have a bad experience & $12 down the drain on a to-go deli sandwich. 

Needless to say if my sandwich needs ever arise again I will be venturing to a sit down restaurant. I will pay the same price but not get a shitty Subway-esque sandwich.
Beach Hut is always delicious! Great atmosphere, friendly staff, excellent food. Try the Santa Cruz, it never disappoints!

It's July 5th my husband and I have some friends in from out of town who want to watch the World Cup. I've never been here so my husband and I thought we would check it out. This place lacks customer service to the fullest!! I want to rate it a negative Star. There are three customers in the entire place when I arrive, so when I walk in and see two employees I thought I would get a, "Hello, hi." Something shoot just some eye contact would be great. So I choose a seat while I'm waiting for my friends and husband.  There aren't any menus on the table and since the waitress does not care to greet me or ask if I would like something to drink, I stand up and ask the waitress if she has a menu. I ask two other times and she doesn't even look at me, finally a mail server walks up right next to her and notices me asking for a menu and he hands me one. I tell him there will be more people coming so I will need a couple menus. He walks away and never comes back. Meanwhile I sit down and start looking at the menu. I look around and see the NOT so friendly waitress go outside and start straightening chairs. At this point I am ready to leave, however I had to wait for the rest of my party to arrive so that we can decide on where to go. I would think taking care of customers is more important than pretending to straighten the patio. The place was practically empty (I doubt there was much to clean). If the owner of this place is having a problem with retaining or gaining new customers you might want to send in Restaurant Rescue to watch your servers. They are not doing a good job. I'm disappointed to see the bar for customer service is set so low. I didn't even get a chance to taste anything from the menu so unfortunately I cannot give a rating for the food at Beach Hut.

Disappointed customer
Just drove by and saw the place and had to give it a try and I'm glad i did it was amazing probably the best sandwich iv ever had! I will defiantly be going back.
Pretty good sandwich! People was nice there. I ordered a small and it was more than enough. They give you A LOT. Definitely worth the price tag. Am a fan.

A great sandwich shop with a relaxed island vibe.  The "Pig Kahuna" is great, but the Malibu is by far my favorite. I always want to try a new sandwich but every time I go I can't imagine anything being as good as the Malibu!   The staff is always nice and you can't beat sitting on the patio to eat when the weather is nice.

Pricey but worth it! Amazing sandwiches and awesome atmosphere! I've had the Santa Barbara and the tuna sandwich. YUM! Definitely a new favorite place that I will be frequenting! Capriottis is the only other place that has sandwiches this good but the atmosphere here is so much better. The outside seating area is so nice and relaxing.
My go-to sandwich place. You had me at cream cheese!! Great music, huge sandwiches and great staff! I recommend beach hut to all!

Although the food is good customer service could use some attention. What happened to the customer is always right every order I heard someone give the girl she said she couldn't add something or change the way that the item comes. I wanted to add some extras on an order of nachos and was told no. Not very pleasing to someone who comes here frequently. Seems like they could do without my business.
Believe the hype!!! Best sandwiches in the area. A little pricey,  but worth every bite!  I'd suggest getting the Santa Cruz or the Malibu, the top 2 in my opinion

Great service!  We ordered a take out and they were very kind to separate items and made everything that much fresher for when we got to our destination. 

 The location was good and looked like a fun place to enjoy a meal. Was actually surprised by their outdoor seating area and that they had beer. In Vegas you can't find many places that offer a cute outdoor area and this one looked nice and tucked in and back a little from the sidewalk. Nice ambiance. 

The sandwiches were yummy but couldn't imagine having them daily for sake of calorie intake. 

The Surfin Cow on Sourdough was stacked high with roast beef and they absolutely don't skimp on the cream cheese. 

Marley Nachos were my favorite. I loved the melted cheese with added bonus of gobs of cream cheese. I'm a tomato fan and these were fresh and tasty.

Hobie- was so good with the dressing. And again they were so nice to put the dressing on the side so the sandwich wasn't soggy. We had plenty of left overs to make multiple meals out of one order.

Potato Salad was also amazing in taste and freshness.

This is my go to place for a salad. My favorite is the chef salad without avocado. I get extra thousand island dressing because it's amazing! I can barely finish the salad because it has so many toppings. (Chopped ham, turkey, salami, cheddar and monterey jack, tomatoes, onions, and Greek peppers. Topped with crumbled bacon and sliced avocado.)

I tried the High Tide sandwich once and it was incredible! (Chopped pastrami, ham, crumbled bacon, cheddar and pepper jack, on sliced, toasted, garlic cheese bread, with fresh-made thousand island dressing) I stick with the salad though because I try not to eat bread that often.

The restaurant is casual and has indoor and outdoor seating. The location is super convenient on S Eastern Ave, close to the 215.

I had one bad experience which almost made me never come back. I did not let that change my rating today. So, my rating is 100% on the food, not the service.

So good!! Awesome variety of toasted subs. The bread was perfect. They had a ton of options. And best of all, they had options that were different than the million other sub shops out there. 

They had a big screen and a comfy couch, so we got to watch some baseball playoffs while we waited for our subs to come out. So worth it!

Just so damn good. 

So far I havent had a bad experience here. It is clean, workers are upbeat and friendly. More often than not they have good games on with cool beers on tap. Though I haven't taken them up on bottomless mimosas that is in my future! 

Everything I have tried has been delicious thus far. I'm curious to try the salads but I am a creature of habit and the spicoli, north shore, and beach comber are where its at. Great little spot, if you are wanting a sandwich this is the spot.

Amazing! 
The food-FANTASTIC but beware... its addicting! We go in a few times a month and have NEVER been let down. The staff is always upbeat and personal. The tunes are great! Excellent selection of Beers to wash em down. Go there! You wont be sorry you did!

This deli was pretty good.  The sub I had was tasty but extremely greasy.  At the end of the day I would definitely go back and try it again but I wouldn't get a different sub.  Their sides were incredible though.

I've decided that I'm a sandwich type of gal.. Especially that I've tried Beach Hut Deli today!

Located besides Pin Kaow, right behind BJ's! Another place close to work and great for lunch!

Coworker and I decided to get two different sandwiches and split it!
All regular sandwiches include mayo, mustard, pickles, tomatoes, lettuce, red onions, peppers and cheese!
She got the Surfin' Bird - turkey, avocado, bacon and cream cheese on a wheat roll.
Cream cheese sounded odd to me but biting into the sandwich was amazing! Creaminess of both the avocado and cream cheese complimented the savory turkey and bacon! 
I got the Hobie - Italian dry salami, pastrami, provolone and Italian dressing on a sweet French roll. Meaty, very tasty and even though my vinaigrette was pouring out of my sandwich it was not over powering. 
Fresh veggies for sure and not drenched with mayo and mustard! Great baked breads also! 

I see myself coming back here for lunch again!

Stopped in a Saturday night and walked into what could I thought was some sort of Rogers & Hammerstein's revival of the "South Pacific."  The band/karaoke was so loud it was difficult for me to process the menu let alone actually verbalize my order. Not to worry if the noise is not your thing, there is a covered outdoor patio area to seek shelter for your ears.  Luckily I had a good idea of what I was going to order based on previous reviews.  I went with The Pig Kahuna.  The GF chose The Spicolli which was an awesome combination turkey,melted cheese, ranch and bacon.  The boy ordered a meatball sub.  Probably the greatest of items ordered were the Marley Nachos.  I disregarded the bread (sadly) on my sandwich but at the hell out of the nachos.  BHD is tasty, serves beer and I look forward to my return.

Excellent spot for some refreshing food in the Vegas heat. The staff is super polite and were so helpful with my toddler getting her some juice and giving her a free grilled cheese when her finicky toddler tastes weren't up for the sandwich we ordered her. THANK YOU!!!

Hair cooked into your food= no return visit.  

Its unfortunate that I won't be back to Beach Hut Deli.  The service is generally friendly and good.  My last and final visit didn't reflect the norm.  

I ordered the Beach Bikini Sandwich and my husband ordered the Buffalo Grilled chicken Salad.  He had to ask 3 times or the salad dressing before any was brought to the table.  Half way through eating he pulled up a piece of grilled chicken that was still attached to the chicken on the plate.  It was attached by a very long hair. Immediately we all lost our appetites.  

We didn't tell the employees before throwing our items away and leaving.  I didn't want anything back or our order remade.  It was just a queasy feeling afterward.   

Wearing hairnets should always be mandatory while working in a kitchen.  I hope they fix this issue.

The sandwiches were pretty impressive on the first visit to this cute beach themed place. The pig kahuna that my husband ordered had bbq pork that was sweetened and topped with chunks of juicy pineapple. My "small" sized sandwich, if you want to call it that had pastrami, bacon and cream cheese which was stacked pretty high. All the sandwich combos sounded great and tasted really good. There is no table service. You order and pay at the counter and your food is brought out to you.
   
The staff was friendly and helpful, met and chatted with the owner who was really enthusiastic and come to find out he also grew up in the Bay Area.  But subsequent visits here were a tad disappointing.  I met up with a friend of mine for lunch few days later.  I ordered a different sandwich, Haole Pizza and my friend had the Santa Cruz.  I don't know mine tasted too salty, maybe it was because it was the meats weren't the best quality. But even the presentation was a bit sloppy, like it was just thrown together and same went for my friends sandwich, it was just thrown together, unlike how mine looked originally.  It also took awhile for the sandwiches to be done because there were 3 orders ahead of us first and only 2 ladies working the counter. Maybe because it was different staff??  So this visit wasn't quite as impressive as the first. And I was disappointed because I dragged my friend here, when we would've gone somewhere else that day.

I came back couple weeks later again for lunch and ordered one of the  sandwiches we had in the first place, the Pig Kahuna and this time around I had the Surfin Cow.  Now that was pretty good, the lean roast beef stacked high, but Mr. B's sandwich, the  Pig Kahuna wasn't as impressive this time around.  It was drowned more in sauce and just had a few pineapple chunks that dotted his sandwich. It tasted just way too salty as well because of all the sauce. He was fine with it, but I just have a thing for when there is  lack of consistency when your food is prepared.  So I havent been really motivated to come back as of late.  Sorry.

I am a deli and sandwich lover and this place ranks at the top for me! Awesome sandwichs, really friendly employees, good beer, and overall a great spot to chill and have a good sandwich. Definitely recommend trying this place out.

Hands down, my most favorite sandwich shop in all of Vegas. The Surfin' Bird is my usual go-to and it's incredible. Beware, the portions are HUGE so I usually just go for the small (medium if I'm really hungry or just really ambitious). Sitting out on their patio with a cold beer and sandwich on a warm afternoon....perfection.

First timer. Excellent menu. Fresh food was delicious and the service was great! Love the reggae music and they have a huge comfy outdoor patio for when it cools down outside!  Good food for kids. They split their sandwich without me even asking :) I had the Mesa salad regular size and wasn't even able to finish! Huge portion size was nice (and trust me, I like to eat!!!) Definitely coming back for $2 happy hour!
I did not have a great experience with the people here. The staff wasn't polite and my sandwich wasn't great for the price.

One of my favorite sandwhich shops, they serve up some rather large sandwhiches packed with flavor in a laid back island themed environment. I find myself coming here for lunch often and would definitely reommend trying both the skinny dipper and woody.

As an added bonus the place also has a small selection of beer on tap and covered outdoor patio seating.

Amazing sandwiches, very fresh, big portions! The Surfin Bird is my favorite by far. Turkey, bacon, avocado on wheat bread toasted is so yummy! I like how they give you a decent amount of meat on your sandwich unlike most sandwich shops. We go here very frequently and love it every time! Highly recommended for a great sandwich!

The Beach Hut Deli is a fantastic sandwich shop with a Mellow beach vibe!.  The sandwiches are huge with fresh meats and vegetables available in 3 sizes. I can't finish a medium and would most likely need a friend to finish a large...  This is my 4th one here and I have had a different sandwich each time.  The menu is expansive and covers all the bases for styles and meats and imaginative combinations that you have never thought of!!       The place it's self is very comfortable and spacious with a out door covered patio and there is a couch area around a tv for group sports watching!! 

Bottom line... If you are a fan of sandwiches  this place should be next of your list to try!!

I've heard soo many great things about beach hut deli so I just had to come in a try some of their subs. Came in with my boyfriend and first we thing noticed was the decor and ambiance, which was great. We were greeted once we came in and the place just looks awesome, plus there's outside seating! On their menu they have very fun names for the subs and it was so hard for me to decide since they all seemed really good. My bf got the "big kahuna" and I got the "drakester" after the worker highly suggested it to my indecisive self. We were both disappointed. Idk, they were both just missing the "wow factor" haha. Or maybe we just had super high expectations from the reviews. Nonetheless, fun spot with awesome happy hour deals and they even do some occasional celebrations with beer pong etc! Pretty awesome! Maybe we just need to try something else next time

The best part of this HUGE HUMONGO sandwich is the cream cheese.  The cream cheese compliments the sandwich and boosts taste by like a million.  It's THAT good. 

***On the menu it states how many calories your consuming with each sandwich..... and just fair warning.... it's DELISH and will consume ALL your calories for the day and probably for the next day.   IT IS HUGE! 

My favorite sandwich is the Santa Cruz COLD.  Pastrami, avocado, bacon, and cream cheese.  A small is 790 calories.... OF YUM.  They don't skimp on the fillers believe me.... They hook it up with a fat sandwich.  

The Haole Cheesesteak is definitely an amazing hot sandwich worth trying.  

It is a fairly new place, and there are a lot of friendly faces to recommend and help you out.  DUDES! come and try something!  It's a cute little place off of Eastern in a really busy plaza.  It's surrounded by a lot of good eats, but definitely come and try this place.  There's a nice seating area outside, and lots of seating inside too.  

On the weekend they have a nice little farmers market and The Beach Hut Deli would be an ideal place to grab some lunch for sure.  

 I work in this plaza and when Friday comes around I'm usually the first to want to grab some lunch from there when I want consume ALL my calories for the day.  :P  It's worth it!
Love this place! $15 for bottomless mimosas on Saturday & Sunday. Also, the sandwiches are delicious & the service is wonderful!

The outdoor seating, groovy tunes, beachy decorative motif, and friendly staff make this place stand out. But they also have giant-sized sandwiches for good prices (a small is more than a single meal for me), and alfalfa sprouts available as a free add-on!

After reading Brooke P's glowing review, I picked the Surfin' Bird, with tons of fresh-sliced turkey, crispy bacon, avocado AND cream cheese, the usual suspects (LTOP), the sprouts I requested, and an extra pop of flavor from Greek peppers! I dig it! A small lasted me two lunches.

Staff were super sweet during my visit: sauntered in off peak times but was immediately greeted and walked through the menu, and sent off with a cheery and genuine, "Have a great day!"

I may be able to make a sandwich myself, but not this good. Or this big. And they don't come with a side of surfin' sunshine spirit. When I find myself on this side of town again, I'll be back... for the Beach Bikini, on Dutch crunch!

Came in here for lunch on a Sunday after stopping by the little farmers market they have setup on Sunday. 

The place was dead empty not sure if it's because of the farmers market or because everyone seemed to be at the crepe place next door. 

I had the skinny dipper, which is a roast beef dip. 

The sandwich was very flavorful and the au ju was very delicious and provided more than enough au ju. 

The roast beef was tender and the bread was amazing. Just wish it had more of a horseradish kick to the sandwich. 

Service was very friendly and top notch and they have lots of tvs and played every football game on at the time. 

Will definitely be back here to try some of their other sandwiches.

By far the best sandwiches in town. They are a chain but we only have one in Vegas so far. My favorite is the Santa Cruz heated. Yum.... Speed of service ok. If your in a hurry call ahead. Prices are a little high but well worth it for what you get. They serve alcohol and have an outdoor area to hang out. Sometimes they have live music. Love this place

This is a great sandwich spot. And it's so much more too. I love the beach theme. The staff are super friendly, nice, and patient. They have a decent sized menu of cold and hot sandwiches, many quite unique. They also have hot dogs and nachos, as well as sides like mac salad and potato salad. They have multiple sizes for each sandwich and even offer a "dude/dudette" size that is half of a small sandwich (which is like a full size sandwich to me). They even have beer! And a happy hour! It's much bigger than it appears from the outside. There's a cute little bar area, large TVs, and even an outdoor area with darts and everything. And on the weekends, they offer $5 bottomless mimosas. $5! In other words, I have found a new spot to hang out. You order at the cash register and then they bring you your food when it's ready. The staffer who rang us up checked on us multiple times, offered to-go lids, etc. Very good service. And the sandwich and mac salad I ordered were wonderful. The sandwich I got was a play on a cheesesteak with roast beef, cheese, cream cheese, and peppers. Unique and seriously tasty. If you want a good sandwich, come here.
Awesome. Love that atmosphere, the food and the staff. Very chill vibe, which is awesome to find in Vegas!

One star for the food only. The price and service are ridiculous. Two small signature sandwiches. Two kids subs (cheese only). Two bags of chips. One fountain drink. $36. I've literally been waiting for 40 minutes. There was one family ahead of 3 ahead of me and they haven't even started my order yet. One girl making sandwiches while one guy watches (he's training and hasn't learned to actually make sandwiches yet).
Great sandwiches and good customer service. Get the Pig Kahuna and their potato soup-it's amazing. A bit pricey but tastes great. They offer food to go as well!

I LOVE LOVE LOVE Beach Hut Deli!!!!!! My coworkers and myself go here often for lunch and are always satisfied. These sandwiches are the real deal, from my daughters favorite "spicolli" to the best sandwich on the menu, the "Drakester". The service and family feeling that this restaurant demonstrates makes my friends, family and myself want to eat here often, oh and the excellent sandwiches help!!! My goal is to try every sandwich they offer, so far I have tried 8 different ones. I recommend the Drakester first and foremost followed by the Shark Bite!! The Drakester is a hot turkey sandwich with melted pepper jack cheese, creem cheese and a couple of green chilis all on toasted sour dough bread. By far the best sandwich I have ever had. Oh and the plates that the meal comes on is a frisbee, kids 8 and under get to keep em!!
Quality food, cute environment, unique and tasty sandwich combos and they serve beer!! We are going to try breakfast next time. We'll be back.

One word. Cream cheese. Eh, two words, I guess. Ha. 

If you don't like cream cheese - you probably won't like this too much. I mean, yes they have sandwiches  that don't have cream cheese - but a majority do. And yes, you can ask for them without the cream cheese - but why mess with their signature creations? 

Portion sizes are pretty good. I get pretty full after eating one sandwich. I will admit though, I had one fatty day at that place. My friend and I couldn't decide - so we both ordered one sandwich and another one to share, plus the Marley Nachos to start with. Damn, i was full. I'm not a big fan of taking leftovers - nor do I like throwing away food, so I forced myself to eat everything. It was one of the best worst decisions I've made. 

The Marley nachos (onions, peppers, avocado, cream cheese, bacon and a few other items) sounded delicious. Kind of disappointed. It wasn't as good as it sounded or as I was hoping. I probably wouldn't get them again, but they weren't disgusting. Just wasn't my style - but my friend loved it. I'll leave it to you to decide. 

The Santa Cruz (pastrami, avocado, bacon, and cream cheese) is definitely one of my favorites. How can you go wrong with any of those items? 

In a strip mall, that's filled with at least 6 other places to eat - beach hut is definitely a stand out. Do yourself a favor and try it out.
Tried this place for the first time yesterday. Had a hard time deciding because they all sounded delicious. Had the "Malibu" and would definitely recommend it if you're a fan of pastrami!

Eating healthy is great, but hard to find around here for a reasonable price. 
We shared the Surfin' Bird 12" sub sandwich - can we say Yum?! It was $13 for it, but the quality was well worth it.

When they guy, i think the owner, says it was pretty big to feed the 2 of us...he wasn't kidding. Granted my husband can eat a whole foot long subway sandwich himself, he ate half of this bird along with 1/4 of my half... and he was full. The sub alone is packed with enough turkey, bacon, avocado, cream cheese, and lettuce to feed almost 2 1/2 peeps. Not only is the bread super soft and fresh, but the bacon...oh the bacon - it was soo crispy, just how i like it. 

The only thing it lacked was not enough peppercinni's (which i love the kick in my subs), and the service can use help as we waited longer (for just sandwiches) than we anticipated. Can't imagine how long the wait would be if there were more than 6 customers in this place.

We hope they don't change the portion of their food down later on, as they are still new.  Can't wait to try the other subs and pizza's! I would recommend adding some desserts or other alcoholic drinks in that place cause it's soo big.

My family and I ate here today based on yelp reviews. The cashier who took our order seemed to have issues concentrating. When we got our food instead of the Marley nachos we ordered we got an half order of plain nachos. They corrected the order and we ate our meal. The same women who took our order was screaming and singing "Let it Go" from Frozen then she jumped on the manager and wrapped her legs around her. We tried to ignore and finish our meal which also included the Woody sandwich. 

I then got up to use the restrooms. The same women then goes to bus our table but then tries to pick up my son from the high chair. My husband told her no and she still tried. My husband could smell beer on this women. My husband pulls my son out of the high chair to get him away from her as I'm walking back to our table. This women then grabs my sons arm. And drags him behind the bar as I'm following after her to get him back. I had to say no then pick up my son. 

She shouldn't have been allowed to work. Then we come to find out that she was a corporate employee. No on intoxicated should be allowed to work they should be sent home. You especially don't GRAB SOMEONES CHILD.

My wife and I had lunch here today.  It totally rocked!!  The sandwiches were amazing.  They do not skimp on the meat, if you're into it.  The veggie sandwich options are much better than other places too.  Great bread, great and FRESH toppings, all sliced in-house.  Steve, the owner was there and talked to us about the place.  He's cool, gregarious and he's got a winner here.  Love the vibe and love the food more!  We're going back.  A lot!!

Went to lunch here today, heard many good things about this place so I figured it was about time. I ordered the drakester with light cream cheese because my husband insisted I tried it with the cream cheese....well the cashier in training mixed up the sandwiches and put light on my husband's instead of mine so when I got my order it was FILLED with cream cheese....not being a fan of complaining in resturants cause I know people make mistakes, I decided to give it a try...NOPE couldn't do it,  warm cream cheese is definitely not for me....so i took it up to the cashier and apologized for returning it but asked if I could get one without cream cheese instead....no hesitation or questions asked, they remade my sandwich and offered me a free side for the mix up. Finally getting to try this amazing looking sandwich, I took one bite and OMG, the taste of amazingness. :) :)

I wasn't as impressed with Beach Hut as many of my fellow yelpers are. 

I walked in at about 12:30 p.m. and grabbed a menu and sat down, browsing yelp suggestions and hungrily mulling over the menu. I finally decided on the "Surfin' Bird" sandwich (turkey, avocado, bacon and cream cheese). The menu says alfalfa sprouts are available on request. I requested them and was informed that they were out. Before I ordered, the lady in front of me was informed that they were out of chicken and roast beef. How can a deli run out of these things? I'm not sure. 

About 20 minutes later (seriously, 20 minutes to make a COLD sandwich that has 4 main ingredients?), my sandwich was ready. I grabbed it and left because I was slightly annoyed with the general attitude of employees. There were three employees and maybe four customers, including myself, waiting for sandwiches. The employees looked like they were just hanging out at work, not being very friendly or helpful and didn't seem to be putting too much effort into making my sandwich in less than 20 minutes. 

When I finally bit into the sandwich, I was very unimpressed with the quality of turkey. It tasted like watered down, pre-sliced, prepackaged turkey from a family pack of processed meat from Walmart. Seriously. THE MEAT makes the sandwich -  not the cream cheese (which I didn't really enjoy too much either) or the various lettuce/tomato/onion toppings. I don't like slimy deli meat. If you do, this is your place?

I wanted to love this sandwich, particularly since everyone raves about it and loves the unique cream cheese addition. But, I didn't love it.  I actually didn't like it very much either. 

I probably won't be back. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, maybe they had an off day, maybe it doesn't usually take 20 minutes to make a sandwich when there are three employees and literally four people in the restaurant, and maybe $10 is a fair price to pay for a small sub (NOT!!!). But, probably not.

Ate here yesterday. Loved the atmosphere, and the staff was friendly. Ordered the woody, messy but delicious! Cream cheese was a nice touch. This place is a little pricier than most delis, but it was worth it. I was also impressed with their beer selection. Had micros I'd never tried.

How good is it? I came here 3 times in one day.... We stopped in for a bite because I saw it as a new place on yelp. Once we got inside I saw the several tap handles of beer.... Oooo this place is getting even better. The wait staff was very laid back and friendly. I had the Marley Nachos and they were AWESOME!!! So much avocado! After eating I had to run an errand in the same parking lot and it was hot. So on my way back I stopped back in a second time for another beer. While there we Struck up a conversation with the owner. He was a VERY nice guy and treated us like we were long lost friends. So after leaving again we had some friends come to town who were hungry...... BACK TO THE BEACH HUT. They were impressed with the place as well. Great Vibe. I was told they have live music so I will be back to check that out!

I looked at the menu and in theory this place is great-They serve cool craft beers and they put cream cheese on sandwiches. A bunch of cute women work here. There is plenty of seating. We ordered a couple subs, one being the Santa Cruz. They were huge and condiments were oozing out. But honestly they give you too much. I didn't ask for anything extra either. I'm sure I'd be pumped if I was Wiz Khalifa having the munchies. There was no harmony, just a ton of crazy things that don't belong together. Another disappointment was the quality of the meat. It was noticeably bad. No amount of veggies and condiments can cover up how the meat was. It had hard stringy pieces and was dry. My husband even had different meat and it was still like that. Maybe a simple sandwich with no meat would have been better choice for me.

Came here to watch a finals game and catch up with a friend but i was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was, and how friendly and outgoing the servers were.  im gonna start hanging out here on my laptop on the free wifi

What's not to like about Beach Hut Deli? Cool beach theme decoration, nice spacious interior and outdoor area, cold beer, delicious food, and large portions. Am I a fan?HELL YEAH!!

You can call them a "chain" which is why I usually passed on the lunch invites, but I probably wouldn't now. If you did though think of a Subway or Quiznos but on steroids. I ordered The Pig Kahuna, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beach-hut-deli-las-vegas?select=rSBykeuQTeYDI_CPbuhaQg#rSBykeuQTeYDI_CPbuhaQg they should call it the Big Kahuna at least that's what I called it when I placed my order.  A pile of pulled pork covered in a sweet, kind of mild BBQ sauce, melted cheddar cheese, and chunks of pineapple in a French roll.  I had the hardest time picking up The Pig Kahuna and taking a bite that I started to use a fork and knife to attack it.  It was delicious and put a smile on my face. They have other healthier sandwiches and other dishes which seemed big also.

They also have daily happy hour specials which run from 3 pm to 6 pm. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beach-hut-deli-las-vegas?select=rSBykeuQTeYDI_CPbuhaQg#_G9o8Wiph6vpLOdvXc0u2g and the happiest hour 3 pm to 4 pm for $1 pints.  Did I mention that they have a lot of TV? Great place to watch a sporting event.

In a desperate search for a weekend lunch change of pace, we remembered Beach Hut and moseyed over. The restaurant itself is much more substantial than I expected. When I think 
"sandwich place", the setup of Subway and Quizno's comes to mind. Beach Hut is an entirely different ballgame. It's big, with tons of seating, both indoor and out. It reminds me a lot of Rubio's in feel. 

The menu is enormous, so I definitely suggest giving it a quick once-over before you go. At first blush, the sandwiches seem a bit pricey (the low end is $7.50 for a small), but, in this glorious case, you totally get what you pay for! They are totally up for customizing your sandwich, which is awesome. You order at the counter, then your food is brought to you at your table. They do have a bar as well. 

The sandwiches were seriously delicious. I had a North Shore and Boyfriend had a Surfin Bird, minus the cheese and bacon. We got them to go and seriously contemplated weighing the to-go bag once we got home. We completely forgot, but I swear, those two sandwiches must have weighed like 3 pounds. So, so worth it. 

The only negative here is the service. They just don't seem to have everything 100% together. From where we were sitting, I could see the sandwich assembly and watched them put ingredients on our sandwiches that we didn't want, then take them off. The sandwiches were then brought to us on trays, even though we had asked for them to-go. They repackaged them in a bag for us, with a bit of an attitude. However, this is one of those rare occasions where the food is good enough to overshadow some sub-par service.

Quiet lil sandwich shop with lots of atmosphere. I tried the meatball sub and it was very good. The size was ridiculous and everything tasted fresh and authentic. About what you'd expect to pay for a full meal, and you'll have plenty left over!
First time at The Beach Hut Deli, great comfy place to eat. I had the Malibu which was great, nice patio and the beers are frosty....

My friend Akia treated us to try a new place today! Beach Hut Deli on eastern and man it's awesome!!! Definitely a do over. I had the Malibu today. Pastrami and Monterey Jack with avocados on a toasted garlic cheese bun. So yummy and the Cajun chips were a delightful zesty change of pace.

Boom. 5 Stars.

Better believe that.

5 stars, maybe closer to 6. It was that good. Every part of my experience at Beach Hut Deli was a positive one. From the recommendation the owner gave to the quality of the food, all spot on. It was 7:30pm, about 30 minutes before the Deli was supposed to close and I was treated no differently than as if I was the first customer of the day. The owner recommended  the Surfin Bird for me (Turkey, Avocado, Bacon, Cream Cheese*, Lettuce, Tomato, Mayo). Why the asterisk? Let me tell you why. Because cream cheese on a sammich is one of the greatest things I have ever tasted in the history of my tasting. It was that good. Maybe others already knew this secret, but I didn't. My wife isn't much of a turkeyer, so she took the owners recommendation as he said, and I quote, "the whole reason I opened this place is because of the Surfin' Cow." Cowabunga. Same ingredients as the Surfin Bird, just minus the bird and exchange it for Roast Beef. Served hot or cold, she chose cold. Outstanding! 

The thing I appreciated most was that we were there until a few minutes after 8. Instead of feeling like I needed to rush out (which I probably would have done had I worked there) the owner came up to us and asked how everything was as. He wanted to know how we heard about Beach Hut Deli and  what we thought of the food. He could have easily ignored us and I would have still given this place a 5 star accolades. I appreciated the extra attention and him going out of the way to make us feel warm and welcome.

Well done Beach Hut Deli. See you soon.
I love these sandwiches and so does my husband,  who can be very picky at times. I usually order the Beach Burger which is hot roast beef and so good!

The place seems nice, and like it might have a good happy hour atmosphere. The sandwiches were alright, although they have a few speciality sandwiches made with cream cheese that just aren't prepared well. I tried taking one bite and this disgusting glob of cream cheese just falls out the back. For a $14 sandwich combo I don't think I should have to come prepared to rearrange and smooth my sandwich to make it edible.

Not bad, but with so many options around I highly doubt we would ever come back or recommend to anyone.

Food is awesome. More then plenty of food for the price. Real food not processed junk. Great atmosphere.  Laid back and fun. The staff was great.  Very friendly. And there is beer. Sunday is game day with tons going on. Beer pong, corn hole toss, darts, and golden tee. It's a local favorite for sure.
The sandwiches here are awesome!  Steve is a really nice guy - took time to talk with our family. We will definitely be going back. I highly recommend.

Catching title and decor in the middle of a desert. Beach Hut Deli has a great outdoor patio with plenty of shade to escape the Nevada heat. The menu is comprised of great beach theme sandwich, burger and salad options. The price is average for a sandwich shop around $11 for a sandwich and a drink. I ordered the new item hightide, it comes with chopped pastrami, ham, crumbled bacon, mild cheddar, Pepperjack on a cheese garlic toast... Oh yeah it is warm and toasted. 

If you are looking for an alternative to the chain sandwich shops give it a try.
Awesome sandwich nice environment couldn't ask for more. Staff was wonderful will be back to this place!

I had the Surfin Bird. The quality of the Turkey sucked for me, especially for the price.  I loved the lettuce that is shredded very fine, yum.  It smells so good when you walk the door.    It got my taste buds going!
Reading the other reviews has brought me to the conclusion there are certain sandwiches there that are VERY delicious and some just so so.  I was not too impressed,  but  I am willing go back and try a different sandwich.  I don't recommend the Surfin Bird.  Also, they should hollow out the bread a bit because everything squishes out the sides.

This is the most grubbin' sandwich shop in the city! The RIGHTEOUS REUBEN was like a flavor punch in the mouth. 
I can't wait to go try their bottomless mimosas next Sunday! 
I'm a dedicated Beach Hut Deli lover
I really dig this place. The menu is great, lots of creative sandwich options. The interior is great and the covered patio is solid too. Like that they have sports on and serve beers too. Hidden gem!

I love this place, and I LOVE that they offer delish gluten free bread! There are not a lot of options in town for gluten free, when it comes to sandwich shops, so I am very grateful! They load their sandwiches up and do not skimp on any ingredients!!! The vibe is chill and laid back, you can catch some beach tunes and Bob Marley while you enjoy your yummy lunch or breakfast! Sunday brunch even has an option for bottomless mimosas $15 from 10-1, in 8 plus flavors!!!! The staff is always helpful and super sweet! Thanks Beach Hut Deli for amazing gluten free options!

I absolutely loved this place! Everything from their laid back chill atmosphere and super friendly employees to their amazing food screams perfection! 

This is definitely going to be my goto hang out lunch spot! I can grab a quick bite to eat or hang out by the patio and have a few beers or mimosas with friends. It's perfect for all! 

They have an amazing variety of sandwiches and their proportions are out of this world! You def get the most bang for your buck at this little Henderson Jem!

LOVE BEACH HUT!!!!! The Santa Cruz and the Malibu are my favorites, both great pastrami sandwiches. They've got great microbrews on tap for really cheap ($7 for a liter of microbrew is a steal!!!). Great friendly, laid back atmosphere. Steven and Courtney are great hosts.
After multiple visits here, I felt inclined to bump it up to 5 stars! Always consistently great subs! Love this place!

Ahhhhh-mazing this place is a relaxing, chill atmosphere, with a great fresh take on a sandwich, truly feels like a beach shack escape, and the people are service-oriented and fun. 

So glad we found this little piece of sandwich heaven! And it's right here in our backyard!

I'm still dreaming about Sunday bottomless mimosas. Sadly, we were on our way to deliver a wedding cake so we didn't have time to enjoy them. Next time!

I wanted to try something new but I just kept thinking about the pastrami melt with avocado. It's on garlic bread and the bread actually has real chunks of roasted garlic. Delish!  They are super super generous with their avocado portions, which I love. I had my 22 month old daughter with me, so I took half the avocado off for her snack and it as still enough. 

Hubby got the pig (?) not sure on name. He said it was so yummy. I would've tried it but I'm a weirdo that always goes no mayo, no mustard, no sour cream, no white creamy sauce etc. I wanted to try it though but he loves mayo. 

Funny story, my previous review was very good (4 stars) but I did mention they forgot to put chips in the to go bag. The girl at the counter must've seen my pic or remembered us (our kid is pretty cute, ha!!) and took care of our chips this time. A little embarrassing, but I so do appreciate the attention to detail in yelp reviews, as I'm the same was a a biz owner. 

Side note, we live in Mountain's Edge, so we actually travel all the way here. Will be back for those darn mimosas!  One Sunday soon!

Funny at

Beachy keen... well sort of. 

From the reviews I've read and the posted photos of this place my hopes were high. But after biting into "Drakester" and half of it spitting out the back of it, I knew this would be a tough sell. 

I walked in and was greeted immediately, with smiles and info. I had arrived during happy hour which means $2 beers after you roll some dice, the number rolled corresponds to what type of beer you get. If you get a beer you don't like, you can pay an extra dollar and get the beer you want, $3 total. Not a bad deal and pretty fun. Happy Hour is only during the week from 3pm -6pm. 

I ordered the "Drakester" sandwich, which is a hot turkey sandwich with melted pepper jack, cream cheese, roasted chili peppers, lite mayo, on toasted garlic sourdough cheese bread. I ordered this with no mayo, but it was still disappointing. The ingredients were fresh and there were plenty of them, but the whole thing fell apart after the first bite. There was way too much cream cheese on this sandwich and I couldn't really taste any garlic on the bread. This was more of a stoner creation a than restaurant quality sandwich. Pretty disappointing 

My foodie partner in crime ordered the, "Shark Bite". this sandwich was very good, compared to the Drakester. It came with canadian ham, swiss cheese, cream cheese, tabasco, BBQ sauce, onions, bacon, lettuce and mayo garlic cheese sourdough bread. After having a bite of this I started to have buyers remorse with my sandwich and convinced my foodie friend to trade halfs. Sucker!

The one thing this place does deliver on is beer. They have a great selection of brews from Stone, Lost Coast, and most recently Rogue Hazelnut Brown - pure goodness. 

Beyond the sudsy love, my experience at Beach Hut was pretty lackluster, but the "Shark Bite" boosted my faith in this deli and I will be back for another and hopefully to update my review for the positive.

Quick Look: 3 Stars for this first visit. Mixed thoughts but it certainly showed some promise. 

In Depth Review: Live right down the road from this gourmet sandwich shop and deli and never even noticed it. Was going to eat at another location in this strip mall and decided to try this location instead. Walked in at about 2pm on a Thursday and nobody was inside eating or in line ordering food. Was this a sign? Girl at the counter seemed a little unenthusiastic and didn't exactly greet us properly or make any suggestions as we stood there lost and starring at the massive menu on the wall. 

The decor is pretty cool and it looks straight out of a So Cal beach town like Hermosa Beach or Pacific Beach. Really liked the decor and the laid back chill music & beach vibe. Place is much larger than it looks outside and has a great outside patio area that would be ideal if it was not so hot. 

I ordered a hot (melted) sandwich called the "Drakester" and the lady ordered a cold  sandwich called the "Beach Bikini." We also ordered a side of potato salad and shared a coke. The food comes out in a Frisbee (love it). The sandwiches cost anywhere between $7 - $12 each. They are not massive sandwiches in size and are a bit high on the price spectrum for this neighborhood IMO. The Drakester was interesting. It consisted of hot turkey, melted pepper jack cheese, a giant slab of cream cheese, mayo and roasted chili peppers on sourdough bread. Didn't look enticing at first. Was messy, required two hands to eat as it wanted to slide in two different directions. But this sandwich tasted pretty damn good! It was a pleasant surprise. Not the healthiest choice, but a delicious choice. The lady enjoyed her sandwich but thought it was just OK at best.  The homemade potato salad was served German style and tasted good to me. The lady thought it had too much mayo. Oh well, cannot please everyone. I approve of it and liked it. 

In Summery: The Beach Hut Deli has potential and I think I will give them an honest second look. As a marketing guy I would advise the owners and management to step up their promotions and advertising. Especially in the near-by neighborhoods. Was there 45+ minutes and only saw one other guy walk in to get a sandwich. Pretty sure he worked at a business in the strip mall. This is a neat spot and would like to see it stick around for a while. Or long enough for that second visit.

I love this place for sandwiches. The bread is always perfect, and the meat is thick and not the crappy meat you get at any other sandwich place. There bacon is fully cooked REAL bacon and its actually thick, the condiments on the sandwiches always taste fresh and they are perfectly placed in the sandwich every time. They have a huge variety of tasty subs and I have never been disappointed in picking a new sub for the day. By far out of every sandwich place I have been to this place knocks the rest out of the water. 
The Staff is also very friendly and my order is always correct. Only reason They did not get the fifth star is because they are a little on the pricy side probably because of the value of the product which is ok in my book.

This place has a cool casual decor with surfboards as your table and a nice outdoor area with live music weekly. They let you sample their beers and don't mind custom orders. I come here monthly to watch the game with my friends and to get quality food. I'm not a vegetarian but I recommend the California. They put a whole avocado on there to substitute for the protein. If I were them I'd charge a buck or two more because it's that good haha

Well I was there last Sunday and waited almost 20 minutes for two sandwiches.  The roast beef was acceptable but the turkey was low grade.  If they are charging 10 bucks for a sandwich it better have fresh carved meat not something I can buy in a pre-wrapped package at the supermarket.  I think this place can be great but they need to fix their speed and quality of meats.  I will likely go elsewhere next time unless they improve.

Soooooooo slow. There's no one here and it's already been 15 minutes of waiting for my food and it's no where in site. $30 for 2 sandwiches chips and drinks is absolutely rediculous to start with. I havent even gotten my food and I hate this place and will never come back here. I don't understand what all the great reviews are for this place is a waste. Yet another shit place that las vegans rant about, because they have no idea what decent food is, even if it is just a sandwich.

Never a bad sandwich here! 

The service is always friendly and attentive. The decor is adorable. The skinny dipper is what I always come in for! Try it, you will not regret it! 

and it's in the same center as nielsens!
Love this place! Huge outdoor patio with lights and games. Great sandwiches with beer on tap. Very dog friendly!

The 3 stars are strictly for the atmosphere! Love the surf board tables, the frisbee plates & the Bob Marley music! However...I didn't go for all that. Went for a simple pastrami sandwich & I left sleepy & hungry. Sleepy...I know you're wondering! Well, I had to wait at least 30 minutes to get my sandwich...and it was not the least bit crowded in there. Hungry...I know you're wondering about that too! Well, it was nasty. Too much hype. Should have gone to BJs as planned.

Amazing! For us native Las Vegas folks, We are blessed that California has finally shared this gem of a sandwich shop. Sandwiches are huge!!! I'll give you a little background on me: I love Philly cheesesteak sandwiches. In fact, I order them just about everywhere I go, and have even eaten them in Philadelphia. I walked into Beach Hut Deli at the recommendation of my little brother, and didn't know what to expect. I immediately was drawn to the cheesesteak sandwich. So I went on ahead and ordered the medium variant of it. After ordering a medium fountain drink, something caught my eye. It was a Sierra Nevada beer tap!!! The gentleman making the food (who I later found out was the manager/owner) asked if I wanted a tall, to which I stated "definitely". He gave me a huge pint of Sierra Nevada Ale for no additional charge than that of the soda. What a cool guy. Minuets later a monster sandwich was presented to me. It was probably 8" long and was over-flowing with tender/juicy steak, cheese, and surprisingly; cream cheese (which was awesome!). I'm not a huge fan of cream cheese at all, but this just WORKED. What a pleasant experience, though I'd share. I live in the area, and this place is my new favorite sandwich shop. I still enjoy firehouse, San Francisco sourdough eatery, and jimmy johns. But this place just stands out, for it's monster sandwiches and delicious beer on tap. DO IT!

There's really nothing to say about this place other than HOLY SHIT!
Honestly, I've been to a ton of sandwich shops in town, but this place is miles ahead of the competition in both price and quality. OH and did I mention, there's freakin' beer here on tap? That's right, enjoy the Valley's best sandwich along with a brewskie? 'Hello God, are you there? It's me Margaret' status up in this joint. 

Happy hour is from 3-7 and has some INSANE deals. Don't pass this baby up.

Very beach-y! Just missing the sand! There are surfboard tables inside and a nice outdoor seating area. Sunday is game day and there's a large viewing sofa to watch one of the six TV screens around the room. There's quite a varied sandwich menu. We had The Malibu. It has hot pastrami and swiss cheese on a delicious garlic cheese bread with mayo and avocado. They obliged me by putting the avocado on the side. My only complaint was that they marinated the pastrami in Italian dressing and it was a bit too vinegary. Next time, I'd ask them to skip the dressing. We will come back--so many more sandwiches to try!

Another lunch spot diamond. This place has really good sandwiches. Even the hot dogs are great here. If they could get the license to open a full size bar this could be a happening spot. I have only been here for lunch and would love to come for dinner with drinks. The servers are really pretty and nice. The flavors are well blended. If you get the cream-cheese spread they put on the sandwiches, it can be overwhelming so ask for it light and you should be good.

My husband and I use to make beach hut our first stop when we went to Sacramento to visit  . So amazing that this is right down the street from us now. I meant to yelp awhile ago love this place and the service is always friendly.

I love this place. I go to school a few doors down at Paul Mitchell and this is going to be my new favorite place for lunch. It is a bit overpriced for a sandwich however a small is practically big enough to feed a family ( ok realistically myself and a friend) . The sandwiches have small unique twist like adding cream cheese were you would never think to put it and all the ingredients looked really fresh. Last but not least I really think this may be a cool place to sit back and have a beer with friends and grub on a sammy... why? because they are a sandwich place that sells beer.

Again an excellent perfect chef salad with the best bacon I ever ate. Ingredients are high quality and very fresh and the salad is portioned correctly.  It is exactly how it is pictured on their website.  I love the fact they give you a choice of lettuce, romaine or spinach as the base for your salad. I chose lettuce and it was fresh and crisp.
I had a medium two meat/two cheese. Lots of meat. The sandwich was good, nothing outstanding though. The bread was average. For the sandwich and a drink was almost $17.00, no side included.

My honey and I tried this place for the first time today and I must say I was so amazed!
Food was so very good and the service is great! Clean and friendly people and so nice on the patio

4 stars for the food, 1 star for the service. After waiting for 10 min while a cashiers just gabbed away at the other end, one of the nice staff members making the food stopped, removed their gloves and took my order.

Food was delicious
I love the atmosphere
I could do with out the girls wearing bikinis though, I just felt sorry for them. 
The service was a bit slow

All in all I would recommend to my friends.

I'm a meat eater through and through, so why would I find myself craving a vegetarian sandwich ? The "California" at Beach Hut Deli is amazing. Loaded up with Avocado and Alfalfa sprouts, full of flavor and freshness. Sandwiches are HUGE, ingredients fresh. The Marley Nachos are great and remind me of BLT flavors in a good way.
The only caveat would be that their "assembly line" could be optimized a bit better to cut down on waiting time if it's busy.

This place is sooo good! My boyfriend ordered the hobie and I ordered the surfing pig! They were both sooo good! The small sandwich was big enough to fill me up! Yes it might be pricier than subway, but you can taste the difference. The only thing I did not like was the potato salad; it wasn't horrible, but I was different. The girls working were very sweet, the atmosphere was good and the food was great! I definitely will be back soon!

Big sandwiches in a game filled atmosphere.

If you like BIG sandwiches, you should definitely go here. Your sandwich comes on top of a monster sub bun with a pile of meat and any toppings that go with your sandwich. I got the Santa Cruz because it had pastrami, the most sensual of all the salted cured meats, and that was a damn good sandwich. It's topped with avocados and a bunch of other toppings, so if you are more of just a meat and cheese type person, you could just go for their plain pastrami sandwich, which I imagine is also just a mound of delicious pastrami.

The thing you need to know before ordering here is the sizes of the sandwiches. They have small, medium, and large sizes, but their "smalls" are actually normal sized sandwiches, the mediums are large, and a "large" is probably a sandwich that could feed the team of monstars. I got the medium, and finished it, though I would have been plenty satisfied with only eating half of the medium sandwich.

If you aren't eating, there is plenty else to do. They have a Wii on one of their TVs to pass the time, some beer pong tables, and a bags setup, making it look like a really fun place to hang out.

The sandwiches here are amazing. I can't believe it's taken me this long to write a review. I thought I had written one a long time ago. I sing their praises constantly. My favorite sandwich is the Malibu. Hot pastrami on garlic cheese bread... are you kidding me? As if that wasn't good enough it also has avocado.... I mean seriously - this is my dream sandwich. The boyfriend likes the Surfin Cow or pig or the Santa Cruz. But he's always conflicted about trying a new sandwich. The main problem being that there are too many good choices to choose from... a great problem to have. 

The place is pretty cute inside and the staff is always super friendly. I've been here several times and always receive the same great service. Parking can be a little rough if it's a busy night for one of the other restaurants in the center, so be mindful of that.

I have been by this place so many times and never had the chance to come and try their food until now. I ordered the Northshore which is one of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time. It's got just the right amount of flavor and I ordered it with light dressing since I'm not a big fan of Italian dressing. Avocado and pastrami pair so well. The young girl that took my order was so sweet, I asked her about the grapefruit beer and she said she was only 17 so she couldn't tell me :) What a doll.. will def be back to try some of their other sandwiches :) Cute setup/decor and loved the music they played.

The employees are always so nice and just cool. And the sandwiches are great! Just an awesome place. And probably the only sandwich place where you can have a beer too. They usually have some kind of beer deal going on, which is great.

I've been here a couple of times now. It seems to be the sandwich spot we take people to when they want a yummy filling sandwich to eat. I love sandwiches and this spot is great. It has the things I love in most of the selections. Cream cheese and avocado! It's a big sandwich and stuffed with a lot of meat. The surfin bird is my favorite! My bfs favorite is the Pig Kahuna.
