Both are delicious. It is so filling! It's a bit on the pricey side but it is worth to get SO MUCH.
We had lunch on the patio with our pugs! The food was good and beer was cold. The service was great.  Can not wait to go back and try more.

I went to this place the other day. I have really nothing bad to say except the menu is posted on two walls a little confusing... But the atmosphere outside patio is so cute!!! Really cool for a deli/rest never been to one like that. The menu was good and I had a BBQ salad seemed pretty healthy :)

I was really impressed with this place when I first walked in the door. This changed really fast after placing my order.
First; $21 for two small sandwiches and two sodas. WAY OVERPRICED!
Second, the cool surf board table were inviting but the table were dirty and covered in trash and red baskets so we didn't get to sit at one. 
Third, these were two of the sloppiest sandwiches I have ever seen. My sandwich fell apart as soon as I picked it up. The bacon was as hard as a rock. It actually hurt my teeth to crunch it. The cream cheese that came in the sandwich was hard and clumpy, not spread like it should have been. I'm sure the sandwich would have tasted better had it not been for the burnt bacon and the frozen cream cheese.
My last, and biggest problem was the lack of professionalism from the employees. I only saw one girl working. The others were standing around, goofing off. Three of the girls were drinking a beer at the bar.
I'm not interested in eating at a restaurant where the employees don't care about their customers.
I will not return to this establishment. Too bad, because it looks really cool and has tons of potential.

I found my newest addiction this week. Beach Hut Deli! Originally I was going to eat at the Spicy Pickle down the street but found out it was closed. I pulled up good ole yelp on my phone and started to look for something nearby. All I had to do was look at the pictures of the sandwiches to know I wanted to eat at Beach Hut Deli.  

Upon walking in I felt like I was at the beach and that was cool by me. There were surfboards decorated on the walls and even some of the tabletops were shaped like a surfboard. The menu is on the wall and I had a hard time deciding what I wanted to try. I ordered a small "Santa Cruz" priced at $8.25 and it had pastrami, avocado, bacon and cream cheese. I got it with everything so it also included mayo, mustard, pickle, tomato, onion, greek peppers and cheese. This sandwich was SO good! I had to get a fork because the insides were just falling out. They didn't skimp on the sandwich at all. I will order this again without a doubt. Hubby ordered a large "Pastrami Sandwich" priced at $12.95 and it just had pastrami, cheese and mustard. He loved it! They have bottled soda or for $2 you can get a cup for the fountain machine that gives you unlimited refills for that visit. Honestly you could easily share a sandwich with someone too they look small in some of the pictures but I assure you they are chocked full. The food was delivered on a frisbee for a plate!

They have a patio area and a happy hour menu Mon-Fri. The sign inside said they currently offer happy hour all day long on Sundays. They have plenty of tv's on the walls too. They also offer catering and party trays or boxed lunches. If you haven't tried Beach Hut Deli yet and love GOOD sandwiches then stop by!

We were craving yummy sandwiches and beach hut deli satisfied! 

We got the Santa Cruz - pastrami,avocado, bacon, cream cheese (in addition to their standard toppings of mayo, dill pickles, tomatoes, red onions, lettuce, Greek peppers, and cheese) - the pastrami was warm and tender and the sandwich was great. 

Also got the Haole cheese steak - hot roast beef, Monterey jack, cream cheese, onions and peppers with a special spicy marinade on a toasted roll. - so awesome. The meat marinade had a peppery flavor and was super tender, the cream cheese and toastedness just brought it all together. 

Definitely will be back here for more!

The sandwiches can be huge so keep that in mind when ordering.
Boyfriend brought me here INCREDIBLE I appreciate that they had our food waiting for us although it was maybe 5-10 to closing. Super nice staff!!

Outside seating is not what it's cracked up to be!!!
Allows people to smoke while sitting outside!!!
Apparently they don't care!!
Just have to report to the better business bureau. 
Will never eat here again!!!!
The changes that have been made are going to cause this place to close for good. After the salads we had tonight I'd be ashamed and just lock it up and don't come back. I'll spend my money elsewhere.

I am not a sandwich person but this place is slowly converting me.

Pros:
-nice customer service
-relaxing atmosphere
-yummy sandwich
-variety of choices

Cons
-a little steep on the prices
-sandwich takes a while to be made even if they are not busy

Overall,I will come back from time to time. It's a spot where you'd have to splurge for food. As a side note, my personal favorite is the skinny dipper! I still have couple of sandwiches to try here as well as mimosas!

This place is really good has a great selection of Sandwiches.  We had 3 different Sandwiches and they were all good. Great customer service and cool Beach atmosphere. The 3 Sandwiches we had were the Surfin Bird, the beach meatball, and the Spicolli all Delicious.

The best sandwich shop in Las Vegas! Yes, better than Capriottis! Incredibly fresh ingredients, fresh sliced meats piled high, soft bread that has flavor, avocado fresh out of the skin, fresh veggies, different cheeses that aren't cut into triangles, and a large menu full of unique choices including the PIG Kahuna, the Beach Bikini and the Surfin Bird. The last time I was there I ordered a simple vegetarian sandwich and had them toast the bread and cheese for me before the other toppings went on and it was killer. The sandwiches are huge, they sell beer including some on tap and have couches for watching football! A great place to grab lunch and watch a game. The staff was friendly and the sandwiches came out fast.  I have been several times and am never disappointed. Go check them out!

Being greeted with a hello and a smile is usually a great way to start off. I had high hopes for this place prior to ever arriving based on the previous YELP reviews that I had read and the pictures that were posted. When I entered the door I knew that YELP had set me up for success yet again. This place smells like the inside of a jar of molasses. The setup is really unique and welcoming. They have covered outdoor sitting (covered being the key word), and lots of space on the inside to dine. 

Heres how my encounter went at the Beach Hut. I entered and showed the nice gentleman at the register a yelp photo and said what is this... AHHH the Big Kahuna he explained. Our pulled pork sandwich with chopped pineapples,BBQ sauce, and just enough spice. 

Solid ill take it... oh yeah and add some of those nachos in the picture. (Caution yelpers don't make the same rookie mistake I made and allow your eyes to order a meal that your belly can't sustain)

First came "The Big Kahuna" which ...dare I say it, is the best sandwhich I have ever eaten. It has just enough spice to compliment the pineapple and sweet barbecue sauce. The bread was soft and fluffy like eating a cloud of perfectly melted flavors. Next, out came the Marley Nachos. The combination of the bacon, feahly melted cheese and avocado puts the Marley nachos into a league of their own. These things are better then good, great is an understatement, I would classify this plate of chips and cheese as a brilliantly crafted, eclectic, pieces of edible art. I ate the entire sandwich and most of the nachos and yes I feel disgustingly full, but man was it worth it. The young lady in the hut said that was the first time she had witnessed anyone order both(allllrightttt). Let this be a lesson to you all when other yelpers warn that the portion sizes are huge, they mean it. 

I don't mean to sound all dramatic and stuff but this is the best new spot in town. Thank goodness its on eastern and not the strip.

P.S. they serve all of their dishes on frisbees, if you bring your little ones in they let them keep the frisbee.

The staff here are some of the nicest I have encountered in all of Vegas. They all seem to enjoy being here and welcome you to stop in for their open mic night on the weekends. This place has a great vibe to it, the music is turned up and the screens all have something worth watching. Really relaxing and welcoming. The food definitely did not disappoint. I had the Pig Kahuna and it was massive. I wished I would of ordered something with some veggies in it but to be honest I enjoyed piggin out. Definitely give this place a shot. 

Great atmosphere, great and friendly service, delicious & well priced food. 5 Stars for sure.

This is a great sand which shop with some good hot sandwiches. It wasn't very busy, but I could see it being a fun atmosphere of it had some more life there. Outside seating is a plus. A little pricey for what you get, but not too bad. Sand which was really good!

The food quality here is on point! The portions are HUGE, and you do get your money's worth. I ordered a small size Pig Kahuna sandwich. It sure was a Kahuna because for a small portion it was huge! Mmmmhmmm....I love me some pulled pork. The sandwich was just FULL of flavor and the pinapple toppings went well with the sandwich. There was so much juice and fillings on the sandwich that I even ate it with a fork. So, if you're down to get al ittle messy. Eat it by hand. If not, I'd reccommend using a fork to defeat the Kahuna.

We also ordered the Surfin' Cow. This was also a great choice. Cream cheese? What a twist to a sandwich. They also added what seemed like a full avocado on there. Who doesn't love avocado. This was also full of flavor and the roast beef was nice and tender.

The service was a-ok. The girls were still getting the jist of everything so the service just needs a little work. The only thing I didn't appreciate was the cashier saying, "Now what?" I don't know about you, but never have I ever gone to an establishment where a server or cashier spoke to me that way, nor do I ever go to a place expecting someone to speak to me that way. Our order took a little longer than normal to come, but the gentleman who worked there was nice enough to offer us complementary drinks and chips for the wait. So I thought it was nice of him to reach out.

Theo ther cool thing is is they also have a bar with a wonderful selection of beer I think there was IPA, Shock Top, and some more I couldn't remember. The establishment is very clean and well decorated. It's a very fun and hip place, with a college hang out feel to it. They also provide flat screens for people to enjoy watching that big game!

I had the Santa Cruz Pastrami sandwich. It was a different spin on a Pastrami sandwich,  but delicious and very flavorful. Sarah was a very gracious order taker, cashier, and hostess. I can't wait to go back and try the cheesesteak sandwich.
Went back in today had a much much better experience with the staff wasn't so lame this time lol food was good good atmosphere will start coming back more often

Sandwiches that give Capriotti's a run for its money in portion size and flavor.  Good service and decor plus having beers on tap is great.  The early closing times are a major let down.  It's like riding the bonzai pipeline only for your friend to knock the board out from under you.

This place was awesome!
Me and my boyfriend came here last night to get a sandwich for dinner. 
We had never been before but it looked good on yelp so we decided to try it out.
First off: the service was great! We arrived at 645 (we didn't know they closed at 7) and they were still totally nice, and just said they were gonna be cleaning up but we could sit ant make ourselves comfortable for a while. All the people were super nice and friendly!
Now the food: I got the pig kahuna and my bf got the bbq chicken, both were delicious! The sandwiches were also HUGE, I swear the thing weighed like 5lbs! Lol the meat was really good, and the bread was so nice and fluffy on the inside, and  lightly toasted on the outside. Of course I inhaled the whole thing, and it was great. 
Overall I'd give this place 2 thumbs up!

Hands down VERY BEST sandwich shop in Henderson and Vegas that I have ever been to (20 year resident). Food is awesome, fresh, BIG, not expensive. Employees are the best. Nice happy hour. Good music (live bands sometimes). Very friendly atmosphere. Eco-conscious practices! Cups are made of a bio-plastic that uses sugars from corn and food-waste instead of oil! 60% reduction in carbon footprint AND they can go in a landfill and biodegrade. Owner Steve is simply awesome. Say hi to him, he's usually there. Olivia and Psalm working this night. Friendly and cool as usual! Thanks ladies! Free super fast wi-fi, so nice place to sit and work for awhile. Highly recommended!

I've been to Beach Hut Deli many times over the years and was surprised that I had never reviewed it.  The vibe is laid back & chill, the staff have always been friendly; and the food fresh and satisfying.  You're greeted with reggae or island tunes, which always puts me in a better mood.  Inside, there are numerous TV's, seating at booths with surf board shaped tables, a large sofa, a small bar area, and there are more tables on the patio.

On this trip we shared the 6" Surfin' Cow sandwich (roast beef, really crispy bacon, cream cheese, mayo, mustard, pickles, tomatoes, sprouts, lettuce, peppers) and the 1/2 size of the Chef Salad (Chopped ham, turkey, salami, cheddar, jack cheese, tomatoes, more yummy bacon, peppers, and sliced avocado).  

I never thought I would like cream cheese on a sandwich, but it adds a creamy texture and a great flavor profile to their sandwiches.  The small 6" size may seem inadequate to fill some people up, but trust me, their sandwiches are packed.  They don't skimp here.

The salad was also very good and on the 1/2 size the amount of toppings actually eclipses the amount of lettuce.  If you like a chef salad, you'll enjoy this one.  

This sandwich shop will definitely stay in the rotation!
Mediocre. Food was ok. Service fine. Decor was whatever. What is beach hut cuisine? Is that even a thing? What happened to pizza joints and sausage carts?
Just ok. Very pricy for what you get. $11 for a small sandwich and a drink? Sandwich was way overloaded with mustard, couldn't taste much else.

Would have loved to try one of their sandwiches but after waiting over 25 min (no joke) we asked for a refund. No one behind the counter seemed to know what was going on. They werent that busy when we got there but they kept giving out other peoples sandwiches. After i complained for waiting to long they I heard the guy get mad cause she gave my sandwich away. There was a guy that ordered before us that waited 45 min and they did the same thing to him after he complained. Three of us ended up asking for a refund and ended up leaving hungry. I have never been to a sandwich shop so disorganized. Will not be returning since I had to return to work late with no sandwich

This place is great! Reminds me of being back in Florida have a great sandwich on the beach. Everything sounds great on the menu but I can't stop ordering the Hobie. 
Great vibe, great outdoor seating and great staff too.

Deli with a burger atmosphere, if that makes any sense.  Located in the heart of what I call "Restaurant Row" on Eastern Ave.  This places doesn't disappoint.  I was very satisfied to say the least. Originally was going to get some grub at BJ's, which is located in the same parking lot.  But a co-worker suggested this place and swears by it. 

The first thing I noticed when I walked in was the decor. Kind of cheesy with the "try hard" beach theme.  Almost reminded me of someone having a beach theme house party. The second thing I noticed was the huge menu on the wall and multiple flat panel TV's. 

Staff was great and if you don't know what to get, they'll suggest something for you. Just let them know it's your first time. 

I got the Drakster, which is basically a Turkey Melt.  But there was nothing basic about this sandwich. About 10 oz of sliced turkey and melted cheese all in a grilled piece of bread.  Sandwich was huge and worth the $10.  I'm a dipper and had to cut the sandwich in a couple of pieces just so I can dip it.  Your sandwich is also brought to your table in a frisbee used as a plate.  I actually thought the frisbee was a giveaway just like those old school happy meals.  You know, the meals that came inside those plastic boats.  Who doesn't remember that.  Back to the sandwich, the best. 

My only issue is that the booths are a bit tight.  Your table is a surf board, which is small for a table top.  You'll find yourself bumping knees with whoever you're eating with.  Might be a good thing depending who your company is. 

TIP 1:  It's probably a crime to add any condiments since the sandwiches are good as is.  But if you need any, ask them in advance.  That goes for any silverware too.  This place doesn't have a separate place for this. 

TIP 2:  Portions are big.  Yes, this place doesn't skimp.  Order a regular if you're use to a foot long Subway Sandwhich.  If you're a hungry man like me, order their large.

TIP 3:  Open mic on the weekends??  Friend suggested I come back on the weekends to do my best American Idol impression.  Yeah right, but will come back to enjoy.

Definitely will be back.  I'm in this area a lot and can't wait to try different sandwich.

Removing  2 stars. came in for my delicious surfin bird that I loved. The blonde girl at the register shouldn't be at a register. Not only did I have to repeat my order 3 different times, it's still not right. Also, you cant not put bacon on a sandwich that comes with bacon especially at that price. Sure the sandwich is good, but not a surfin bird without without the bacon. Sad that next time will have to check the sandwiches and unwrap them next time I come in before I can leave. Makes the takeout process longer when the point of take out is to be quick. Disappointed
Probably one of the best sandwiches I've had. Very friendly staff, clean restaurant. On top of the great food, where else can you enjoy $2 happy hour pints?!?

Wow! I rarely eat sandwiches, due to gluten sensitivity, so it has to be amazing for me to eat. If I told you I went back 3 days in a row, would that be a good validation? On top of that, I don't eat roast beef, and the Woody, which is warm roast beef, barbecue sauce, cheddar cheese, onions, lettuce, bacon and cream cheese; makes this place very special. I've tried a few different sandwiches and all are great, but the Woody is what has kept me coming back so far. Tiff, the manager is super cool too! Go say hi! I can't wait to try all of their other tasty treats!!!

I had the medium Santa Cruz today and I must say it was awesome.  It also filled me up all day and wasn't even hungry for dinner.  They have an excellent selection of quality beers and i definitely will be hitting up their happy hour for some great deals.

We were in the area and getting hungry. My husband asked 'Are there any places nearby that you have bookmarked on Yelp?' I pulled up this place, and after viewing photos of their sandwiches, the decision was made.

We decided to split the Malibu. Hot pastrami and melted Swiss on toasted garlic cheese bread, mayo, Italian dressing and avocado. This sandwich was excellent. The pastrami was so flavorful, and they did not skimp on the avocado at all. We were still taking about this sandwich the next day. 

The shop is very inviting. Really cute with its surf board tables and beach theme. There were booths, some comfy arm chairs and outdoor seating. Plenty of tvs around the entire place, each on a different sports channel. What was cute was that our sandwich was served on a frisbee. Great touch.

I've come here two days in a row now for lunch......so I guess that means I love it?
When you are big fat preggo lady, you need to stay away from lunch meats. However, I figured its heated pretty thoroughly it should kill any lurking bacteria. Yesterday I had ordered the Woody. I thought it was pretty delish, but the Tabasco gave me heartburn (thank you pregnancy again). My husband tried the other half and he thought it was WONDERFUL! He said he would make the drive to Henderson to get a fresh one himself. 

Today I went back for lunch since I am lazy and it was a short walk from my office. I decided on the skinny dipper. It is pretty tasty and no heartburn this time! People say its a bit pricey, but I've never seen so much meat on a sandwich before. It's definitely filling and worth the price. The bread is never soggy even though its heated! Definitely a winner!

I definitely will be back and this place will be in my weekly rotation for lunch!

When I discovered this place, I knew I could no longer eat at the sandwhich chain that promotes healthy eating and weight loss. There's nothing healthy about having a sandwhich that has a huge chunk of cream cheese and regular cheese and mayo...and I freaking love it!!! My taste buds are happy little campers every time I leave this place.
My two favorites are the surfin' cow and Santa Cruz. Each sandwhich is packed full of meat and veggies, like freaking huge. I always have them add sprouts to the sandwhich, it gives it that extra kick for me. I always get the sandwhiches toasted. Super yummy, especially with the cream cheese.

My only bad experience was when they accidentally left the bacon out of my sandwhich. Instead of bringing the bacon on a small plate or a napkin, the guy just came over to my table and handed it to me with his bare hands. Ummm, can you say gross? I just didn't eat it. But I love this place and I will be back:)
Had lunch with my wife and we split the bbq chicken and a few beers from their tap. Plenty of choices and still our go to place for a really good sandwich!!!! Easy to get to location on Eastern.

I was recommended to this place by a friend, and wow I was pleasantly surprised. My fiancée loves sandwiches and I'm a pretty big fan of them myself. Having been burnt out on the traditional ham-cheese-mayo-turkey and vegetables that you find in most sandwich restaurants, I was pleasantly surprised to find this shop/lounge was nothing of the sort. All of their menu items are brilliantly described and the taste is even better. Loaded to the brim with all of the fixings and a wide assortment of condiments and ingredients that are not considered standard by most means, ie cream cheese. 

The price is a little on the steep side when you're considering you're paying for just a sandwich, but this is about as gourmet of a sandwich as you can get without it really being a gourmet sandwich. These guys make big, tasty, attractive sandwiches. Try it, I doubt you'll be disappointed.

Not to mention this place doubles as a bar/lounge area, with plenty of TV's so swing by on a Sunday and watch some football while you chow. Yes, that means beer too for you calorie lovers.

As for me, I'll be coming back fa-sho!

Checked this place out today, man, it was good! I wish there was one of these on the west side of town. The next time I'm in that area, BAM! I'm there again for sure! Had the Shark Bite; perfect sandwich! Love the atmosphere as well! It's a beach atmosphere with the reggae music playing. Really makes you feel like you're on vacation!

Excellent sandwiches and a friendly staff.  These are super sized sandwiches loaded with veggies, bacon, cream cheese..... served on a frisbee.
You cant go wrong here. Sandwiches so big many people are using a fork and knife.  These are good sandwiches to share
Did I say they put cream cheese on the sandwiches - excellent!!!??!

It was instant love for me with Beach Hut Deli. I've known about this spot for awhile, but wasn't in a rush to try "just" a sandwich place. I've been missing out as a result.

During my visit to the deli we were greeted by the friendly employees as soon as we walked in. When they brought our orders to the table they waited a minute to make sure we had everything we needed. At the end of our meal someone came out to make sure we enjoyed everything. Great service!

My second Beach Hut Deli experience was a take-out order at work. Ordering for an office was also easy. The menu was easy to find on their website. I called in the six orders and the woman that took my order repeated everything back at the end for accuracy. All of the orders were correct when we picked them up. We were quoted 15-20 minutes to prepare our order and it was indeed ready when we arrived in that amount of time.

The menu is very unique with sandwich and sub options that you won't find at other delis. Regular size subs are 6" and Large size subs are 9". I was happy to see that they have a Dude/Duddette option which is 3" for subs and half a sandwich for the gourmet sandwiches. The subs are all loaded with meat and toppings so for me a 3" sub is plenty with a side. 

The Hobie is their version of an Italian with salami, pastrami, provolone, and Italian dressing. It's loaded with meat and toppings for a delicious and filling sub. The Mahalo Taco (special) was one of the best subs I've ever tasted. It included taco seasoned roast beef and chips. Trying to describe the amazing flavor of this sub is impossible. The flavors all worked so well together. This sub was also packed with meat and toppings. The High Tide has pastrami, ham, bacon, pepper jack cheese, and thousand island dressing on cheese bread. It was very tasty, but I think the sub bread is better than the sandwich bread. The Potato Salad and Pasta Salad are both obviously made in house and are delicious. The Potato Salad has large pieces of potato with skin on and a delicious dressing. The Pasta Salad has orzo pasta, cheese, sundried tomatoes, and artichokes. The flavor is great.

They allow dogs on the patio, which is nice. The sandwich and salad we ordered were fresh, but nothing gourmet or special. The girl working the front was spacey. 


It has some weird Hawaiian-Jamaican vibe, but is based in CA.  I guess it's a good outdoorsy place to grab a beer, but I won't be dreaming of returning.

Beach Hut Deli is awesome. The Surfin Bird and the Surfin Cow are delicious. Portions are outstanding! You will definitely get full here. The photos people have posted are true advertisement, so yes the sandwiches are really that thick. Best sandwich shop I have been to in years.

Was hungry for something pastrami based and with enough meat to tell what you are eating. Two words...Santa Cruz. Fresh bread, generous toppings and a pile of meat. Carnivores will go away content. I really hate to say this but move over Capriotti's and Weiss. Also check out their happy hour specials. Nice selection on tap. Okay only thing preventing that fifth star is they have coke products and I am a Pepsi person. Will be a regular stop, you bet. Forgot to mention staff was great, answered questions and offered suggestions. Great lunch experience! Look forward to hitting a couple happy hours...32oz craft beer for $4, move over Barley's.... Nah can't go that far.

What could I say about Beach Hut Deli sandwiches? Quality. Big. No, huge portions. Order a small and you'll be fine. I am fine for TWO days in fact because a small sandwich can be two lunches for me. Fun, cool island vibe and awesome staff. Oh - brewskis if you want them. Yes, I just said brewskis. Haha.

I used to visit BHD in Reno when I was in college. I remember the shop opening up and daaaaaaaaayum the sandwiches were good. They're still good today. I was so happy to hear there was a location that opened up here.

I came in during Noon-time and it actually wasn't even that busy which was surprising, but they must get some good crowds for their happy hour. YES. This sandwich shop has a happy hour.

I had the flying pig, which has pretty much everything I love in a sandwich. Tasty ham, bacon, avocado, cream cheese, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and thin cut red onions. GAH. I am salivating right now. Order it hot. Or not. Both ways are good.

My only issue is this... since there are so very many sandwich places in this particular area it's kind of hard to choose the best. But even though I love BHD, I think Firehouse Subs is better, but that's just my particular taste. Mainly I pick Firehouse over BHD because of the perfect sizing of their sandwiches. Firehouse's sandwiches can actually fit in my mouth, um, as dirty as that sounds. And they are easier to eat. But really, both places are better than Subway or POS. 

BHD - I will be back.

Loved the one in Reno when we lived there. So stoked it opened in Vegas! This place kicks ass!
Check out the Santa Cruz, and try it hot with the works! Pastrami, avocado, bacon and cream cheese... epic!

A friend of mine decided to bring me to this place. We live up north in Las Vegas and I thought the drive would be a waste to drive here just for a sandwich, but was I wrong. 

Warm and juicy sandwiches have been one of my favorite things to eat now and this was the perfect place for just that. The "Shark Bite" was absolutely DELICIOUS! I found it weird for the sandwiches to include cream cheese, but it actually tastes really good! The spot is nice and chill and the variety of sandwiches they offer sounded pretty great as well. 

I definitely look to drop by here anytime I'm down in the area and hopefully one day there will be one a bit more closer than this. Overall, great sandwiches!

Delish. Don't let the "small" fool you. They seriously over stuff their 6" sandwich (see my photo)....to quote Homer Simpson: "I can't believe I ate the whole thing!". The sandwich itself was tasty, and they clearly put in some effort to make it look assembled nicely (again, look at my photo).  Overall, I didn't mind shelling out the $9 for a sandwich. The interior is a little kitschy, but so am I. I'll definitely be back the next time I need to scratch my sammich itch.

Yum!! Delicious sub sandwiches with a Cali Cool feel.  I get the Veggie California with avocado, sprouts and I add tuna.  Gourmet made to order.  Such a fun real staff!! I love Andrea and Louise.  Surf tunes playing and killer micro brews on draft.  Pipeline Porter. Great White.  An outdoor patio.  It feels like home.  Oh and they have Dirty chips - Funky Fusion is the best :). All for about the price of Subway.  Thanks guys - never change :)

Finally got to com here for lunch today and it was pretty good. Nice beach theme inside and the restaurant was very clean. I had he beach bikini sandwich and it was sooooo good! Boyfriend had the sunrise which is a club sandwich. They put a lot of meat and veggies so it's worth the price! Cant wait to come back and get the bikini sandwich again.

(B) I've been to 2 locations a combined total of 5 or 6 times. I've never been there during an event, although I'm pretty sure they have musical guests every now and then. For that reason this review will be based mostly on food. I was there during happy hour though, and you get to roll dice for drink specials, so that was kind of fun.
   On to the food. I've had "The Woody "a couple times and Cali Cheese Steaks on a few occasions. "The Woody" , which is a hot roast beef sammich, with tobasco,bullseye, bacon, cheddar, cream cheese,mayo, onions, and lettuce. It's a bit pricey for a Sammich at aroun $12, but it's huge. For the typical person, they'd probably have to take half home. The cream cheese is genius, and tobasco is not hot. If your not into beef or BBQ, this is not for you. I highly recommend it. Like I said, this is too big for a single serving, but I found myself stuffing my stomach to the rafters! Typically this would be a high end roast beef sub, but the addition of bacon, 2 sauces, and cream cheese, AND then cooked?! Well that just takes it to a different level. As for this sandwich alone, 4 out of 5. Brisket would get em 5.
  About that Cheese Steak doe...Very good. The way they make it is with Monterey jack and cream cheese. So they call it like a California Cheese Steak. It very good. They grill all the ingredients together. This makes a beautiful mixture of peppers, cheese, and beef, just playing off of each other. Now you can customize this and get cheddar and what not, what ever veggies you want, but what I will say is that there no cheese wiz. So if you're trying to get an authentic Philly, this is not the place. That's why they call it a cali cheese steak. I'd still give this a 4 out of 5.                  
   Onward to the Beach Comber. Now this is what another person in my party got. "It's a lot of food, and very fresh. It's like you really got it from a deli.it is a customizable sandwich, so you can get exactly what you want."
   When it comes to mid priced, and fast served sandwiches this is a TOP SPOT. I've never had bad service. I've always left satisfied, they have a great beer selection, and the food is plentiful and great. I highly recommend this place!

Fantastic sandwiches!  Their prices are higher than your average sandwich shop but you definitely your money's worth. They pack each sandwich full of high quality meats and vegetables and the bread is soft and delicious. I'm not easily impressed by most sandwich places but this one made my top 5.

My favorite place in town for Sandwiches. The Spiccoli is the greatest and they have great beers on tap for a decent price. Outdoor patio has bags, and decent music is always playing.

My kids love it as well, they have grilled cheese AND PBJs. Happy hour consists of rolling a die and getting a dollar off the corresponding beer... It's awesome.

Best chill place to eat sandwiches and drink decent beer in the whole area.

After a weekend in Las Vegas, we ended up having our best meal here on the way home to Phoenix. There were 6 of us and all ordered something different. All of us were happy with our choices. My daughter's "Surfin' Bird" (Turkey, avocado, bacon and cream cheese) sounded simple but, with all the trimmings, was mind-bogglingly large and utter perfection. We also shared a Skinny Dipper which was excellent and also loved the Malibu (Hot, chopped pastrami and swiss on toasted garlic cheese bread with mayo, Italian dressing and avocado)  Never thought to put avocado on pastrami but will definitely think of it next time. I only wish they had a Phoenix location.
Freaking Beach Hut Deli mannnnn. I swear, I'm telling everyone about this place! If you're looking for an amazing gourmet sandwich this is THE place to go!

I placed an order through postmates and when my order was delivered to my house I noticed I was missing a sub. I called beach hut to find out if my sub was just forgotten at the store and the manager tiff apologized for the missing sub. She even said that she would be willing to drive it down to my house to deliver it. I was so shocked that a manager would actually do this so I drove down to pick it up myself and thank her for beyond the best customer service. I will definitely be back.

I have to give major props to Beach Hut deli for making my Valentine's Day extra special!! I ordered my boyfriend's favorite sandwich from here through Postmates so it could be delivered to his office. I spoke with a woman on the phone, possibly Tif?, and asked if she could include a note for him. She said that wouldn't be a problem and I checked in again once the order had been placed. 

I was expecting a scribbled note on a napkin, which I would've been totally fine with, but instead she took the extra time to cut out a heart shape piece of paper and write the note very nicely on there. 

He was SO surprised and thrilled with his delivery and the note is now taped up in his kitchen :) Thank you so much for going the extra mile Beach Hut deli!!

If you want large sandwiches , no holding back of the ingredients, and 1st class service make the Beach Hut Deli a top on your list. They have a menu of mouth watering meals for any taste bud! The owner and his cadre of incredible staff make your food and experience awesome. Eat here once and you will be a convert.

P.S. They have liter craft beers for less than anywhere in town and rad theme nights.

One of our clients brought a beautiful tray of sandwiches for lunch today. I went straight for The California which had avocado, red onions, tomatoes, alfalfa sprouts, banana peppers, Monterey cheese, and mayo on wheat bread. It was wonderful! So I immediately had to do more research about this deli and I am sold! The ingredients are incredibly fresh and I absolutely LOVE how much stuff is in the sandwich! The other three sandwiches look just as delicious (one has turkey and bacon, the second one has pastrami, and the third had pastrami and turkey).  I don't think I could ask of much more out of a sandwich: fresh ingredients, lots of vegetables, and tasty. I will definitely be taking my sandwich-loving fiancé to give it a whirl!

My first Yelp review. Growing up in NY/NJ, I'm probably a foodie elitist so I apologize if I come off as obnoxious:

Vegas is definitely devoid of top-knotch sandwich shops.  Even the best ones have this sort of mass-produced quality.  Being used to "mom and pop" sandwich shops where everything is made on premises I'm pretty picky.  I do have to say that this place is pretty darn good.  It reminds me a little of Johnny McGuires at Town Square. 

The bread, meats and toppings are all good quality with very original sandwich concoctions.  While it still has that mass-produced feel, relatively speaking it's definitely one of the standouts in Las Vegas/Henderson.  They don't shy away from the amount of meat and try to just drown out the sandwich in toppings like a lot of sub shops do.  You definitely get your money's worth and I'll definitely return. 

I ordered the "Santa Cruz" sans the Avocado.  Good meat, great bacon and loved having cream cheese on the sandwich.

I don't know why I never took the time out to rate Beach Hut. I got a job here a few months ago and when I started my first day everything seemed great.... Until the corporate manager came in. She was filthy drunk dancing on customers and singing throughout the whole restaurant. People couldn't even enjoy a nice meal and on top of that their manager (Tiffany) is the worst manager in history. She was trying to get all the employees to drink on the job!!!! If I asked her a question about how to make a sandwich cause they make you remember everything on the menu she would get frustrated and yell at me. I quit after my third day working cause I was not going to take abuse from a work place. This place is full of unprofessional people that want to party before working and giving customer service. They didn't great customers nor take care of them. They simply walked around drinking beer from the tab and pretending to clean. Horrible business. Horrible customer service. They need a rescue and someone that knows what their doing.

Ok i eat here alot more than i would like to admit. Its always awesome,  the marley nachos are amazing!!!! I have mine with pineapple and bbq sauce.  Their warm sandwiches are big and filling and so delicious you don't want to miss a thing. I love the hard root beer on tap for HAPPY HOUR !!! which by the way is a very happy time for us at beach hut. We love tiffany the manager she is friendly and caring and fun. The staff in general are kind and helpfull.

Dude! This place is AWESOME! Me and husband were hungry and came across this place, so we decided to give it a try. I ordered the North  Shore and my hubby ordered the Righteous Rueben. Let me tell you, I'm originally from frisco(San Francisco for those of you not from the bay) and when I bit into that sandwich it immediately brought me back to memory lane. Its like I was having a taste of the bay and this sandwich just put me under a spell. My husband devoured his sandwich in euphoria and said that we should make it a weekly routine to come here. Food is BOMB DOT COM!

Love this place!!! I'm a vegetarian and they have so many options!!! My boyfriend, who is a carnivore, loves it too! They also have beer and a patio you can have dogs on. Also the pasta salad is super good yummmm!!

This place is straight out of my husband's childhood. It started in Granite Bay, CA and as you can see, it has grown from there! There is an amazing selection of sandwiches (of course) and some delicious looking nachos. You will be surprised by how much sandwich you get for your money. But wait there's more...happy hour! Including draft beers (stone & wasatch to name a few). The happy hour deal, I'm sure I will be trying this week, is marley nachos & a a pint for $9!!

The atmosphere is delightfully cartoonish and therefore perfect for Vegas. Besides the surfboard inspired booths inside, there is a large area outside for dining when the temperature hits the other side of 100. 

I recommend the Surfin' Bird - hold the mayo. Enjoy!

Minus one star for paying for my chips and the cashier not giving them to us.

The staff here does a great job at explaining the different sandwich sizes by detailing the amount of meat that goes into each particular size. All of the sandwiches here are unique in their own way from offering items like pineapple, or cream cheese. Me and my +1 shared the Pig Kahuna and were stuffed! The sandwich was full of flavor (with a nice kick from the tabasco sauce) Note: These sandwiches are served open faced, don't plan on folding it or it'll fall apart because there's so much meat!

Though their hours aren't the most Vegas friendly, Beach Hut Deli offers a true "beachy" experience with their décor and menu options. I definitely plan on returning to make my way down the menu!

PS. They have several beer options if you're feeling particularly thirsty.

I've never had a bad sandwich here. This is one if those places that always delivers. My new favorite sandwich is the shark bite. I highly recommend it. Ham, bbq sauce, cream cheese, bacon, lettuce, red onion on a toasted garlic bread. Delicious.

Went there for "happy hour"... Wasn't too happy. Weird service/ ordering system. Was asked to order & pay right after stepping into the joint... Had no idea what drinks they even had to choose from. After questioning the cashier, she rambled off a couple beers I have never heard of. She let me try a sample of one, which I didn't care for. Left after my boyfriend finished his beer.. I think he enjoyed it tho :)
Delious veggie sub! The Monteray is so tasty and I could only finish half a size medium! Great bread and about 2 avocados on my sub! Huge!

We polled our whole family and it's a consensus five star. If we weren't passing through town we would have gone back the next day. And the day after that! Generous portions of tender, fresh (not processed) meat, perfectly cooked bacon and fresh avocado made every sandwich we ordered a taste sensation. The staff was fantastic.

Before we get to the food, I just want to say.... what great service here as the staff are nice and very helpful.

The Wait - You are going to wait for your sandwich. Don't come in here thinking it is going to be like Subway or Port of Subs.  Each sandwich is handcrafted and the ingredients are very fresh!  We waited about 15 minutes for all our sandwiches to come out.  The good news, if you go at the right time, try one of their beers that they have.  Great flavors.

The Sandwiches - Wow.  The taste is wonderful. I won't go into describing all the different types, but you can look them up yourself.  All I can say, is that you are getting great quality ingredients, fresh, a ton of them and the sandwiches are created with a lot of "otherness" to them that makes them taste great.

The Salads - Had mine as a salad as I did not want bread.  Next time, I am going to try it with the lettuce wrap.

The beers - What a nice selection of draft beers that are from those beachy type of places.

The ambiance - Very cool, very room, very nice.

GK says, great food, service and quality.  They even made a special for my vegan daughter.

Check it out!

This place is freaking amazing. Go here, try everything, get a beer, sit on the patio (if it's nice outside of course) and enjoy yourself. My boyfriend and I recently went here seeking amazing sandwiches and they delivered!!! We ordered beers, sat on the patio when the weather was perfect, and listened to Jack Johnson and Bob Marley which really made us really feel like we were by the beach... The food is delicious!!!! YUM!!!!!!

I'm so disappointed in my Santa Cruz sandwich:( 
There is soooooo much mayo that I can't even find the bacon. Every time I bite into it the mayo squirts out the side of my mouth. 

I won't even get started on my husbands meatball sandwich.. He eats everything and he won't even finish it!  

I'm really bummed out and sad that I just sent $38 on a horrible meal.

Great first trip, I passed two sandwich shops on the way over including one a few doors down from this one and so happy I did. We got turkey and provolone and a tuna sub - both excellent but we both agreed the turkey won. Cheapskates might not like it since you can't get a footling for 5$ but for people like me who value quality over quantity definitely stop by! I would have given 5 stars but the pasta salad had an odd pickling flavor I couldn't place and didn't care for. I loved that a sandwich could get as creative or as plain as you liked since some sandwich shops are trending toward mashing any flavor combinations that come to mind. Super friendly staff and a completely casual atmosphere are perfect for a surf side sandwich shop feel. The space is huge too so lots of room to spread out.

Beach Hut Deli is a Las Vegas gem.  The laid back atmosphere, generous portions, and delicious sandwiches are unique to the Las Vegas restaurant industry.  

I've only had the pleasure of visiting Beach Hut twice, but I plan on returning as soon as another sandwich craving hits me.  Call me crazy, I actually ordered the Surfin' Bird two days in a row.  The mix of soft bread with cream cheese, bacon, and avocado makes my mouth water as I type - if only this was a zero calorie entree!

I'm leaving 5 stars because I want you to experience Beach Hut Deli, but BRING A SWEATSHIRT (think Jimmy John's temperatures).  It was freezing both times I visited the Eastern Ave location, however, I'd much prefer it to be cold than warm.  

Check it out!

I've been to Beach Hut Deli twice now. I have to credit my husband Joel for finding this place on Yelp. If you have the munchies this place is for you. 

Their sandwiches are nothing short of epic. If you have a small appetite best plan on sharing because Beach Hut's sandwiches are HUGE! Their menu has so many choices which makes it hard to pick. Not only do they have sandwiches they have hot dogs and even homemade soups. Some sandwiches we have ordered were the Skinny Dipper, which had roast beef and melted cheddar cheese. Plus, it came with a side of au jus. The Woody is my favorite so far. It oozes with roast beef, cheddar cheese, red onion and cream cheese. That's right huge globs of cream cheese. Mmmmm all those flavors just melt together between the soft rolls. I also have tried the Clam Chowder and the pasta salad. I know they specialize in sandwiches, (which are amazing), but the soup was luke warm and lacked seasoning. The pasta salad had a sweet note that I did not enjoy. 

I love the seating on the inside of Beach Hut. They have a huge couch as well as regular chairs and tables. The outside patio is a nice change, but be careful some of those chairs hurt your bum! Sitting outside when the weather is nice is definitely part of the charm of Beach Hut. I do really like the staff here too. They are always so friendly and look genuinely happy to be there. 

No matter what time of day or what problem your having a Beach Hut Deli sandwich can cure you. With their melty cheese, flavorful meat and their boldness to use cream cheese you just can't go wrong. Mmmmm it's calling my name right now! LOL

I had this notion that I wanted to go on a hike today and since I hadn't eaten anything I thought why not grab a sandwich and enjoy it after my hike. What a fab idea, if I do say so myself! 

I came in and they were vibing out to reggae. I knew I would love this place right off the bat! I decided on the Surfin bird before arriving. I ordered a large to share with my future husband. I took it to go and shared it with my love after we made our way up black mountain. The veggies were still crisp and the sandwich wasn't soggy! The creaminess from the cream cheese paired well with the bite of the onion. I added sprouts but the sandwich normally comes with turkey,bacon, avacado, tomato, lettuce, onion, pickles, peppers, mayo, mustard and cream cheese. I couldn't have picked a better sandwich to eat on a beautiful day after a great hike. Probably one of the best cold cut sandwiches I've had. The bread was freshly baked too everything about this sandwich was so yummy. 

They also serve beers and mimosas. Bottomless mimosas are $15 and they have beers on tap including a kona longboard 
Lager and other unique ones I haven't seen before. I'm not a drinker and I'm not familiar with beers anyway, but if you are you can definitely get one and chill here on the couch and catch some tv or watch the game. 

I look forward to trying more sandwiches from Beach Hut Deli I love the beach theme and the cool vibe here.

Ok, sooooo I'm a sandwich lover and I've walked in here a couple of times, and just couldn't bring myself to paying $9.00 for a sandwich..... and no chips and soda for that price!  So I ordered a pastrami!  I can't say much about the service, it was ok, nothing stood out!  The bread was super soft! the pastrami was ok!  I don't think it was worth $9.00.  I can go to Zupas, and get a salad and a sandwich for $8 and some change!

I might go back and try there dry salami sandwich, but other than that, I don't see me going there on a regular basis!

This sandwich shop does not disappoint!  There is a nice California surfer vibe inside with cool art work.  There is also a covered outdoor patio.  My go-to sandwich is the pastrami and the portion size is huge! I usually share with somebody.  These sandwiches are stacked and it is a challenge to get everything in one bite; however, each bite is delectable because you get an awesome flavor and texture combo everytime.  There is crunch from the bacon, onions, and pickle. Creaminess from the avocado and cream cheese.  All of these combined make a great sandwich.  They offer happy hour on beer and nachos.  The nachos are pretty good too!

Took my second trip to BHD recently and it was better than the first.  This time, smartly I might add, I brought my wife so we could get two sammies and split.  We went with the Spicolli (delish turkey breast, bacon, ranch, lettuce, french roll) and the Skinny Dipper (roast beef, melted cheddar, onions, mayo and au jus).  I'd be hard pressed to tell you which one I liked better.  Traditional french dips I come across seem to be lazy and played out.  The beef isn't what it should be and it's just another sandwich.  Here the beef and cheese are in perfect harmony - and there isn't so much mayo that it's over-bearing and oozing out.  The only bummer is that I liked each sandwich so much I'd be afraid to try a different one.

Other pluses - they serve beer and have several HD TVs (with sports on).  I also believe they have free wifi because the first time I went there was a big group of guys doing a fantasy football draft.

Bright and airy with a friendly staff. Large menu selection of unique sandwich combos.  Some unique micro brews also available. Prices are average and there is a large outdoor seating area and surfboard tabled booths.

I really wanted to like this location.  I mean I REALLLLYYYY wanted to like this spot.  I grew up near Beach Hut in northern Cali and it quickly was one of my favorite lunch spots of all time.   I was stoked when I moved to NV and saw that they had a Beach Hut, it was one of the first places I had to go eat.  Upon arriving, I gave my order to a worker that I'm not sure knew where he was.  There are certain things I like on a sandwich and certain things I don't, usually it's not complicated and this was no exception.  Somehow just ordering turned into an approx 10 min ordeal.  I wish I could explain how it took so long to just go through what I wanted and what I didn't, but unfortunately I went through the process of repeating it twice (very slowly) and he still seemed confused.  The sandwich came out after another 10 min wait and was awesome, the food here I truly can't knock, it really is good.

The next time going here was fairly uneventful luckily (which truly should be expected at anywhere I go).  There was a longer than normal wait considering my order was the only one they were making, but the food made up for it.

My next trip here really bothered me to the point that I don't wish to go back.  I want to say, I DON'T mind waiting if the food is worth it, I may get a little annoyed considering there's typically no cooking for a sandwich, but I'll deal with it and be happy.  So upon walking in, I head right to the counter and give my order for a To-Go order.  Based on my previous experiences with Beach Hut in general, I know it'll take 5-10 minutes at least.  After being outside for maybe a minute or two tops, a young girl calls my name and tells me that my order is ready, which I found out.  I asked if she was sure it was mine which she tells me "yes", I repeat back what I ordered just to make sure because this seemed unusually quick.  She again tells me that it's mine while looking slightly annoyed.  Unfortunately I feel like somehow it's my fault for not trusting my gut instinct and actually opening up the sandwich and checking to make sure it was right.   So fast forward to 15-20 drive home and opening up "my" sandwich... well... i think you can guess that it wasn't mine.  If it was just a minor screw up like the same # but with/without onions I would be ok with it, but unfortunately this was just completely a different sandwich.  I don't prefer to have mustard and this thing was loaded up.  

Normally I'd chalk it up to just a normal error like when Fast Food happens to toss the wrong item on your burger, but this just doesn't have the same feel to it.  If there was more people inside ordering at the time I could understand just tossing the wrong sandwich in the wrong bag, unfortunately there was only 1 other person ordering and that was after me.  Best guess is they screwed up someone's sandwich and found a quick way to get rid of it.  

I'm sure in the future I'll break down and give this place another shot based on my love affairs with the ones from my home town, but I just don't see it happening anytime soon.  It's been 3 months since my last time here and I don't know when I'll try it again.

The food really is great and based on that alone I want to rate this 5 stars, just the employees/service bring this one down so badly to the point I feel 1.5/2 stars is appropriate.

Happy hour was from 3-6    2 dollar beers i have never heard of. Had long board   Was actually very good. Chill atmosphere with several tvs  hockey was on so it immediately caught my attention. Only had a couple beer sthen had to leave cause they were closing but the food looked tasty. Neat looking place.

Oh how we love beach hut deli.  Very cool vibe. Love the Monterey sandwich.  And the nachos. What doesn't taste better with a bit of cream cheese?   Service is always friendly and fast.   Nice size portions and good prices.  This place should open for UFC fight nights etc like Buffalo Wild Wings.  I'm sure they would do well

I would never eat here again! I ordered the bqq pulled pork nothing about it was pulled it was cubed extremely spicy and drenched in bbq sauce! After taking one bite I asked to exchange it but they made me pay for a whole new sand which after spending 35$! I waited forever for the new sandwich that I decided to take it to go.Not only was  the manager rude, but she made everyone else's sandwhich who came after me first. The soup was bland and watery no cheese, which one would expect from chicken tortilla soup, they also visibly microwave everything to warm it. Gross never again. I'm still hungry!!
Had the pulled pork salad and it was amazing!    Ice make was down, but the pulled Pork salad was AMZING!!!

We all love this place... myself, my wife, and the dogs.  Great selection of sandwiches, vegan, vegetarian, meat eater etc. Perfect for us as I try to keep it vegan and my wife is the opposite. They also have a great selection of soups. Vegan ones as well. 
Their is a fabulous outdoor patio that us and the dogs really enjoy. Inside has plenty of seating and tvs with sports on most often. Oh yeah let's not forget they also have a good beer selection on draft and bottles. Do your self a favor and go enjoy this place.
 I almost forgot to mention the friendly and fast service. Every time I've been here the kids or adults working have been kind,helpful and do there jobs well.

Was looking for a new Deli....nothing like a good sandwich. Went online, read the menu and saw that a lot of their sandwiches had cream cheese in them and one of my favorite delis of all time had cream cheese on it so I thought, why not...let's give this place a shot! When we pulled up, a typical strip mall location. The sign was a little hard to see...but when we walked in it was decorated with a great beach theme. Walked over to the counter grabbed a menu and decided what to have. The cashier was very friendly ...asked if we had any questions...welcomed us ...we ordered 2 sandwiches, my man had the Hobie a  pastrami and salami with provolone and Italian dressing medium in size, he brought half home because it was so big and packed full of meat, and I had the beach bikini, turkey with sprouts, sunflower seeds, and cream cheese...on wheat bread. I took off the cranberry sauce. We sat down at our table which was a surf board. We liked the atmosphere, nice reggae music playing and for how busy they were it was pretty quiet. I looked outside to their patio and think when the weather is cooler, it would be really nice to sit outside, have a beer and play their corn hole games set up. When our food came out a very friendly staff member brought it to us, asking if we needed anything else. The sandwiches were served on a frisbee...great idea!!! Perfect for the theme! The meat was WONDERFUL, fresh ingredients. Really tasty pastrami! The only thing I would have added to mine was some purple onion and maybe a tomatoe...but it was wonderful regardless!!! ;) we will definitely be back...even though it was a drive for us...it was definitely worth it!

10 times better than Lee's next store. I was going to order the medium sandwich and the guy looked at me like I was on bath salts. The small is really a LARGE so stick w/ the small. 

Sandwich was great!  Would totally go back. 

My only drawback is 1) I asked for mayo on the side....I got mayo on my sub and 2) there's no healthy sides [pasta salad something] all their chips are the full fat varietal as well. No baked, no sun chips, nothing :( 

Not great for healthy side eaters, but on the flip side they proudly display calorie count of all sandwiches on their menu :)

This place is hidden. I would have never found out about it if a friend hadn't of brought it up one day when we were out for lunch.

I tried both vegetarian sandwiches and they were awesome. These sandwiches are huge, and I mean HUGE! I ordered the small both times and they both were HUGE! I swear they put an entire avocado on them! 

You can eat inside or out, and the outside layout reminds me of something I've seen in LA or Palm Springs. Can't wait to come back and try some of their other sandwiches. Slowly but surely working my way down the menu. And the staff here is super nice! If you haven't tried this place and like a good sandwich, add this to your list and do it now! :)

LOVE this place! Amazing sandwiches, ambiance, and customer service. My favorite place to go for lunch and have a few beers. It is so relaxing and feels like a home away from home. 

The sandwiches are huge and so scrumptious! I especially love the cream cheese added. yum yum yum!
Yummy! Great service and fresh, yummy sandwiches. This is our new spot to pick up sandwiches. So glad we found it!!

So I have been hear twice, and both times the food and service was great 


They always accommodate the fact that I do not like cheese, and most places would not substitute but they do.  

Price is a bit more then a good New Jersey or NY hero but it is worth the price in the  long run

Absolutely amazing sandwiches, great atmosphere hands down the best sandwich shop in town. The Santa Ctuz and skunny dipper are my favorites. The sanfwhiches are the right price, a large being 14 dollars but you get everything at a premiium and not a thin line of meat like the other guys. If you havent been here GO NoW!

Food: 12" surfin bird with alfalfa sprouts and Italian dressing added with bread toasted and a grilled cheese on sliced garlic sourdough. Split bird with hubby and sandwich was huge - I couldn't finish my half. 

Location: on Eastern in same plaza as Lee's sandwiches and Smashburger. 

Enjoyed dog friendly large patio with nice tunes playing! 

Service: very friendly and helpful!

I love coming here for lunch.  The sandwiches as delicious as they are huge! Every time I've come in,  I've been greeted by the friendly staff. I especially love the patio area where you can eat outside on nice days.  I usually come after the lunch rush so I've never seen it busy in here.  The wait for food or service has never been long for me.

/wow, wow wow!!!!

New to the Henderson area fresh from the Westside of the LV valley, I was craving a deli sandwich for lunch (I also want a beer with a meal 99/100 times)... So my boyfriend suggested this place and we scooted down to the Beach Hut Deli. LOVE! 

This fun little place is in the middle of a bustling shopping center filled with cool shops and other great eats, but once you spot the Hawaiian style dried grass canopy outside on the patio during the warm Las Vegas day you will want to enjoy a meal here on a reoccurring basis. There is a large seating area inside full of TVs, cozy booths, and a giant comfy couch. Every where you look you will find something fun to look at. There are gorgeous sunset murals and fun beachy signs. The patio is very large, well lit, and covered.

The menu is filled with a bunch of perfectly unique sandwiches that aren't too wildly out there. I had the Woody... hot roast beef, bbq sauce, crispy bacon and a slice of cream cheese among other things, your standard melted cheddar cheese, mayo, onions and finely shredded lettuce. My honeypie went with the Spicolli. hot turkey breast slices with melted cheddar cheese on a toasted roll with ranch dressing, lettuce and bacon. We both ordered a small size sandwich and traded a half with each other. (It's the funnest way to try things!) Both were absolutely delicious, but I was much more partial to my sandwich. I would have enjoyed the toasted roll of his though. Sadly, I didn't get my full Hawaiian fix because they were out of mac salad!!! They do have potato salad and an Italian style pasta salad too, but I really needed that mac!!! Large section of potato chips as well.

They have beer on tap!!!! I. LOVE. BEER. Let me warn you, the large beer is L.A.R.G.E. I'm talking huge. Too big for me, which is saying a lot. It might be... like.... a full six pack. Ok, not a full six pack... but by our estimation it was a solid 40oz of frosty cold brew.
 
Another HUGE bonus is Rogue Hazelnut Brown Ale ON TAP!!!! It's quite tasty and one of my favorite beers ever!!

It is a very laid back eatery, although a little too laid back in the safety/health department. Don't read me wrong, it's VERY clean. I am just slightly particular having worked in the food service industry before. The girls working the station were wearing sandals, which let's be honest- the second you drop a knife cutting my sandwich you are going to lose a toe. Also, I FIRMLY stand by the ponytail rule: if your hair is touching your shoulders, it should be pulled back into a neat ponytail. It's not a fashion show, it's my lunch.

Overall 4/5 stars. I will return for sure, but I hope to see some close toed shoes and properly managed hair. I also know to ask for a toasted bun on my hot sandwich and order the small beer.

5 years ago I was living in reno and beach hut deli was huge there. When I say huge I mean long lines crowed shop and sometimes up to an hour wait for a sandwich. But obviously if you have had there sandwiches it was so worth the wait. Now moving back to vegas I was sad that the only time I could get a bomb Santa Cruz when I visit my sister who is still in reno. Now finding out there is a beach hut deli here excited is a dull adjective to discrive my feelings. Now I live a good hour away but it is so worth the trip. Vegas people do not understand how amazing this place is. Walking into the shop I was amazed to see the lack of business!! This place is huge with games and so much sesting. Great beers and obviously  amazing food!!! Seriously we need to make this place poppin! Spears the word  and get vegas to understand  the goodness of this place not only for substance but also for the welcoming atmosphere! I hate driving so if I can make there drive then  you can!!!

Beach Hut Deli seemed to be all the rage at work, so a bunch of us decided to go one day and it was the best decision ever! There is a really cool island vibe inside, surf boards on the walls and your sandwiches are served on Frisbees. I love the automatic doors and the giant menu on the wall so you can decide what you want without holding up the line. I have since been here about 3 times and look forward to coming back again really soon. 

On my first visit I went for the classic, surfin bird. When it arrived it was so large I wasn't sure how I was going to eat it. You definitely want to stick to the small! The sandwich had great flavor and everything really worked together perfectly. I was a little worried about the slices of cream cheese, but it added a nice creamy texture to the sandwich. On my next visit I split the Spicolli with a friend and we were a bit disappointed. The ticket machine stopped working so we waited a little longer than normal and then the sandwich didn't have much flavor. We could taste the turkey and bacon, but not the ranch which would have really tied the flavors together. I came again the next day for lunch with my husband and fell in love with the Hobie. This classic Italian sub really did it for me. I loved the Italian dressing and all of the flavors really worked perfectly together. I also really love the Dirty brand potato chips that they sell, they are super delicious and a perfect crunchy compliment to any sandwich.

This is easily one of the best sandwiches that you will find in Las Vegas. I love that their sandwiches all have a twist, rather than being the same old sandwiches you get anywhere. They definitely have a signature style and flavor profile and I am a huge fan. I am already excited for my next visit!

Come with an appetite because these sandwiches are packed full!

So far I've tried the surfin bird and santa cruz. These are both cold sandwiches, and they're pretty much the same but one has turkey and the other pastrami. Along with the meat, they come with avocado, bacon, cream cheese, mayo, mustard, pickle, onion, lettuce, greek pepper and cheese. Like I said, the sandwich is packed full! The cream cheese is an interesting topping, which I like, but I personally think it's spread on a little thick. The sandwiches come in small, medium, large and I would definitely suggest splitting if you go for a medium or large, as they are quite filling. The hot sandwiches sound pretty interesting too, so I'll have to come back for one of those. 

Along with the food, they also offer beer which is pretty awesome. They usually even have happy hour specials for both the beer and food. 

For a chain deli, the atmosphere is really nice and you have an option of sitting inside or outside. And outside, you can sit in a covered or uncovered area. I even noticed they had the supplies for cornhole for customers to play. Definitely a great, casual place to check out.

Ummmm all I can say is YUUUMMM! 

the Malibu with a great white is where its at! 

Moved about a month ago and i miss this place. 

Best sandwiches in town by far!!!!

Ridiculously long wait for a small sandwich. There was no one in line when we walked in, just a couple of people sitting at tables in the back. 

There was no one at the register to take our order but one of the young girls working there said she would be with us in a minute. We continued to wait. We finally had our order taken and went with the Malibu, hot pastrami and swiss on toasted garlic cheese bread. 

We must have waited well over ten minutes and when I picked up the sandwich it was already disappointing. It was really small, and looked like something I could have made at home in 2 minutes. It tasted fine but nothing anyone else couldn't have done in half the time. The bread seemed like regular white bread, did not taste and garlic or cheese. The menu descriptions sound great, but the actual product falls short.

I love the open area beach concept of this location!  Even though it is in a "Strip Mall" type environment you can really get the beach feel.  The menu is posted on the wall, so I felt it was a bit hard to read, however they do have a paper version if you would like. The menu has many options from hot & cold sandwiches to salads.  They also have the calories listed so if you are watching the waistline, you can make a choice based on that!  The Surfing Bird sandwich I had on the Garlic and Cheese Sourdough bread was a huge helping of a sandwich!  I could have easily taken half home but it was so yummy that I ate it all!  It included the following fresh ingredients of turkey, avocado, bacon and cream cheese.  The cream cheese and bacon combo was delightful!  I wonder why I had never thought of that before!   

They do offer beer as well!  I'm planning on coming back some evening with a group of friend to sit relax and enjoy!

So I accidently stumbled upon this place while in a rush and starving for something super quick. Well I was very suprised!

Service: I walked in and was greeted with smiles! The guys behind the counter were not only super friendly but hilairous and had personality! You could tell they really enjoyed the food, they were either stoner surfer guys or total foodies; either way their passion for the place itself made be very content. They told me about the trivia nights, live bands and drink specials so I will def. be back. Over all the atmospere that those guys created was great (and I was only there for 10 minutes).

Food: Amazing! I forgot the exact name of the sandwich I had but it had hot pastrami, cream cheese and avacado...SOLD!

I will def. be back to really sit with a cold beer and enjoy the music!

Went here for the first time with the wife on Monday for Lunch. After reading a good menu and noticing a fine selections of beerwe both chose different sandwitchs. I Had the Sinnydipper and my wife had the chesse steak. After what was a wait that I felt was longer that it should have been the sandwitchs arrived delivered to of table by a waitress that appered to be the only one serving. Both sandwitchs were great delivered hot. There was lots of very moist meat and good cheese. The bread was really good. The atmoshere here was great If you don't like Bob Marly you may not like the music but I thought it was great.The place is clean, the server was nice and the overall experience was great. They may need to hire a couple of more prep people or servers but we'll be back often. Food alone was worth it.

BEST SANDWICH I HAVE EVER EATEN! 

I took the other half to-go so I could recreate the "amazing first bite" experience again. 

Manager helped me create a custom sandwich and it was to die for. 

Very friendly staff, clean and fast!
